I'm the very proud father of my 14 year old son, was a successful owner/operator of my own screen printing business for 15 years, and recently have been getting by as a landlord and a handyman for hire. I am a diesel and small engine mechanic, a property manager, a carpenter, landscaper, tree worker, lumber sawyer, graphic designer, and avid gardener and chicken herder. By necessity I've taught myself to do whatever needs doing with the attitude that if a thing can be done, then I can do it as well as any. Now I want to re-invent myself as an inventor, and The Firebox is the first one on my list.    The Firebox is a premade fire in a box, much like the packaged firewood that you see in your local store, except that The Firebox becomes a comfortable log wood fire with just the touch of a match. Clean, efficient, and long lasting, I want to have the Firebox available in stores throughout the nation and then perhaps around the world. If you like the idea of the Firebox, and would like to have it available in your local store, then now is the time to act and make a pledge. I'm running a 45 day campaign to establish a national demand and also a state by state local supplier network capable of filling that demand. It's a tall order, an ambitious attempt, and I'm confident that you will see the value in this campaign and help out as best you can to make the Firebox a reality.      A firebox burns for about 3 hours in three stages. The first hour is the burnoff and topper log consumption. Once the toppers have burnt sufficiently, about an hour, they are dropped into the center and the rail logs spread out a bit, creating a coal bed perfect for grilling your food when you put your grill over the rail logs. This cooking section lasts about an hour and then you pull the grill and roll the rails logs up for the final burn off. Here you might want to throw on some more logs, or maybe another Firebox.     Because of state laws forbidding transportation of firewood over state lines, and because of the prohibitive costs of fire wood transportation, and not least because I want the Firebox be a means of supporting local rural economic empowerment, the Fireboxes you receive will have been made not only in your state, but most likely in your local region. The good news here is that when you support the Firebox Campaign you are not only supporting a product made in America, but also made in your state and likely your local region, thereby supporting your own local economy. The bad news is that, until we establish a local supplier in your region, I won't be able to fulfill your perk. It's a bit of a risk, but I'm hoping that the idea and the product is good enough that we can blow right through the initial establishment of demand phase and start enlisting suppliers in the regions where the demand is.      This campaign is pretty much my job now, and I'll be working non-stop to make it successful. Like you, I am a veritable force of nature once my intention is clear and I know what I want. Trust me. I'll be using all of my obsessive compulsions, all of my fairly vast experience, and call in every one of my favors, real or imaginary, to make this campaign a success and to make sure your pledge is fulfilled. So catch fire, this is happening now. Make a pledge.What We Need & What You GetI'm setting the goal at $25,000 and using flexible funding mainly because it allows both paypal and credit card contributions. What we really need though is your support and then, more than anything, we need to establish a state by state and regional supplier network. The Firebox is a good deal for suppliers, and will enable them to make 2-3 times the money on their woodlots. It likely will take a season or three to really get rolling, and initially they may have to modify their current stock of firewood, but long range it will be well worth it, and any suppliers willing to get on board early will get special attention and consideration when the Firebox really takes hold. This campaign is an opportunity to get in ground floor on something that will enable you to make a good deal more money for your work. The numbers are fair, the product unique though obvious, and your involvement crucial. $1,500 is a considerable chunk, but your investment will be virtually guaranteed as it will come with a local customer base which you would be wise to expand. K.O.A. campgrounds, state and national parks, local retail outlets, get some cards made free at vistaprint and establish more accounts. Once we get rolling I'll turn my attention towards establishing national retail accounts and you will be hard pressed to keep up with the demand, and always making more money. I promise. My job will be to produce and supply the boxes, the point of purchase displays, moderate the forum and web site, and then work on establishing models for extracting fuel wood from forests while making them more healthy and less prone to wildfire.     I've set up the perks to cover a range of end user involvement, a reasonable buy in for suppliers, an upper tier for retailers, and ranges for more minor and then angel levels of involvement. In the beginning of this campaign I think the $1-$50 dollar pledges will be the heart of the matter and I urge you to take the chance. It's your initial support that will give the suppliers the confidence to get on board the campaign and thus enable the fulfilling of your pledges.     I've included with the 5 and 10 dollar pledge levels, rainbow stickers. These are over 20 years old, vintage original translucent rainbow stickers. This is kind of a flyer, but I've got thousands of these and they are virtually unobtainium.  I remember  fondly the Seventies when these were common on the back windows of cars and held only the meaning of happiness and appreciation of natural beauty and I want these to be the new environmental stickers of the age. So for 5 bucks you get one, and for 10 you get two. They're cool stickers, you can't get them anywhere but here, and you'll be supporting a worthy campaign.Other Ways You Can HelpNo matter what level of involvement you are able to contribute to, or even if you cannot contribute at all, I urge you all to share the Firebox campaign with your friends. Tell your local store about the campaign and let them know you'd buy Fireboxes if they were available, let your local firewood guy know the opportunity exists. C'mon, it's just the click of a button, the comment at the store, a phone call to your local firewood guy. Tell your friends, they'll like it too, everybody likes a good fire. This is real and it's happening right now.

story:
We recently hit the streets in our EVV (Emergency Vitamin Vehicle) to promote VitaPerk with the "Smart YOUR Coffee Challenge".  We found dozens of eager participants that were excited to try VitaPerk for the first time.  Watch the video below to see their experience.  (Note: VitaPerk does not make YOU smart, only YOUR coffee!)



According to the World Health Organization, more than 2 billion people worldwide are vitamin and mineral-deficient.  Globally, over 2 billion cups of coffee are consumed every day.  Did someone say opportunity?

Add VitaPerk to ANY coffee and you'll enjoy a convenient 15 vitamin and mineral boost that enriches your coffee experience with essential nutrients.  That's smart.

Our Story

Sharing a deep passion for coffee, health and people of good humor, two friends pondered an easy and convenient solution to this worldwide problem.

What if, they wondered, that rich and steaming cup of coffee not only woke us up, but provided a substantial serving of vitamins and minerals as well?

Years of research, testing and caffeine consumption yielded an answer:  VitaPerk. Offering a blend of vitamins, minerals and natural flavors, it turns average joe into something brilliant!

VitaPerk is what coffee has been missing. It’s what you’ve been missing.

VitaPerk:

- Conveniently delivers a proprietary blend of 15 vitamins and minerals into any coffee.

- Provides 50% of the recommended dietary allowance of vitamins B3, B6, C, D and E in each serving, as well as other vital nutrients your body needs.

- Can be added to any cup of coffee - specialty, hot or iced.

- Is gluten-free, naturally-flavored, kosher and only 5 calories per pack.

- Is offered in four varieties:  Original, Hazelnut, Vanilla and Energy.


PERK@Work:  Drink smarter, work harder.

From the first sip in the morning to the afternoon pick-me-up, coffee is an essential part of the workday.  In fact, 65% of people drink coffee at work.  

Take advantage of our Indiegogo perks designed for your workplace, and help take coffee in your office to the next level by enhancing it with VitaPerk.  

Our PERK@work rewards make it easy for everyone to get the benefit of our blend of vitamins and minerals.  And it offers forward-thinking companies a productive and convenient way to promote healthy habits and wellness for their employees. 

Help your employees get all the nutrients and vitamins they need to perform at their best.  



Why Indiegogo?

We're on a mission to make coffee smarter.  Now we want your support to be able to revolutionize the coffee experience.  Because Indiegogo is comprised of adventurers, explorers and innovators, you can be among the first people on Earth to PERK the World.  In addition to shouting VitaPerk from the rooftops, we invite you to take advantage of our exclusive offers and packages designed only for Indiegogo.

Share Our Story.

Smart Your Coffee.

PERK the World.

Frequently Asked Questions

VitaPerk is the smartest thing that ever happened to coffee, so the intellectually curious want to know more. Here are some of the questions they’ve been asking, along with the best answers we can come up with – after having our coffee plus VitaPerk.

Why should I “Smart My Coffee” with VitaPerk? Why not! VitaPerk takes coffee to the next level, with the vitamins and minerals your body needs, plus the great taste of our natural flavors.

Can I still put sugar, cream, milk, soy milk, almond milk, coconut milk, artificial sweetener or honey into my coffee?  Absolutely! VitaPerk is intended to be a healthy addition to one’s normal daily coffee routine. It can also serve as a healthy substitute to flavor one’s coffee without artificial ingredients and just a fraction of the calories of other popular coffee additives.

Will VitaPerk Original affect the taste of my coffee?  No, VitaPerk Original won’t alter the great taste of pure coffee.

Can VitaPerk be added to any coffee?  Yes!  Even iced-coffee!

Can VitaPerk be added to other beverages?  At present, VitaPerk is a patent-pending formulation that is intended only for use in coffee.  However, we are hard at work in the lab to create innovative ways to smart other food and beverages.

How many calories are in a VitaPerk package?  Each package contains only 5 calories.

Is flavored VitaPerk manufactured with artificial ingredients?  No, VitaPerk flavors are naturally flavored.

How much of the VitaPerk flavored blends should I put into my coffee? Everyones’s palate is different, but we advise for use in 12 oz. – 20 oz., however we generally recommend flavoring to taste.

Does VitaPerk dissolve quickly in coffee?  Yes, within seconds of stirring VitaPerk into your coffee, it will be ready to enjoy.

Why would I use VitaPerk if I already take a multi-vitamin?  VitaPerk makes taking vitamins convenient. Plus VitaPerk plus coffee is pleasant. Swallowing a capsule or pill is not – and 40% of adults agree.

How do I know that VitaPerk really provides the vitamin and mineral benefits described?  VitaPerk’s vitamins and minerals have been independently tested at average coffee temperatures to ensure efficacy.

How does using VitaPerk contribute to a socially responsible lifestyle?  With each purchase of VitaPerk, we donate a percentage of profits to Vitamin Angels.

story:
Swish: The Perfect Shot

Swish was created by founder Dean Alms who is equally passionate about tools (a garage full of them) and craft cocktails.  Dean brought together his two passions to create Swish, a unique bar tool for making your favorite craft cocktails.   

In 2020, with most happy hours taking place at home, Swish turns the 5 o'Clock hour into an even better cocktail experience.   Swish will elevate your home bar and showcase your love of craft cocktails.

Swish elevates your bar experience

Swish is an innovation on the traditional jigger, with stainless steel construction and thoughtful design to make your pours easy and streamlined.  Hold the swish above your glass, pour in your spirits, then push down on your glass, shaker or mixer and watch as it releases cleanly out of the bottom of the funnel.  When done, place Swish back on the stand and catch tray.   At the end of the evening, both Swish and the catch tray and stand are ready for the dishwasher.

Key Features of the Swish

After a few years of designing and prototyping, Swish is in production.  Pending arrival from manufacturing, we'll start shipping out to our backers. Currently, Swishes are due to arrive into HQ in December.

Primary measurements of 1 oz, 1.5 oz and 3 oz on one side and
Secondary measurements of .5 oz, .75 oz and 2 oz on the other.

The Swish measurements we created were the result of feedback from many backers and their favorite drink recipes.  Primary measurements have an etched in ring around the complete diameter of the Swish. Secondary measurements have a small line on the opposite side of the stainless steel funnel to indicate the level of the pour.

 

The Swish Story Continues

Swish is our first product and we want to make it widely available.  Since we're still in launch phase, crowdfunding helps us get early product feedback and funds the first wave of manufacturing.  It also helps us get the word out there about Swish!  After Indiegogo, we're targeting to make Swish available via retail distributors around the world.   Now is the time to get your Swish at the best price.

  • We have reached our funding goal on another crowdfunding site.
  • We believe there is a loyal crowd on Indiegogo who would also enjoy an elevated cocktail experience.  We manufactured additional Swishes to reach the Indiegogo audience.
  • You can make a pledge for a single Swish, two-pack and a four-pack.
  • Each Swish comes in a well-designed package ready for gift-giving.

Risks & Challenges

The production of Swish is underway and will be shipping to the USA shortly.  You can be confident of receiving this product if you decide to back us.  If the shipment from the manufacturer arrives by December 2020 as scheduled, you should also receive your Swish in December.   

COVID has increased shipping demand worldwide with online shopping. In conjunction, this holiday season is predicted to see one of the biggest shipped goods spikes. So, there is a risk that the shipment of Swishes may be delayed until after the holidays. To be on the safe side, we are estimating that you will receive your Swish in January 2021.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out and share Swish on your favorite social network.   Use the Indiegogo tools for maximum impact.

story:
Hello, I've put up this page because I'd like to raise $500-$1000 to be set aside in a fund for costs relating to car maintenance and/or housing.  The car is a 2003 Toyota Camry as pictured.  Anyone who donates will receive a signed copy of the fairy tale “What Goes Down Must Come Up”, which I've also included below, as well as an audio rendition of the tale.

Take care and be well,

Jeremy








------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What Goes Down Must Come Up:

Jilleas and the Yo-Yo


A Song


Breath on the Wind

Jilleas awoke as the sun crept through the eastern window of her bedroom in the straw house she shared with her grandmother.  The straw house, whose body is composed of firm straw, and whose roof is laid with lighter straw.   She sat up, and she stretched out her arms as the light continued to rise, tickling her eyelids open.  She then went to wash up and returned to her room to don a flannel shirt and a fresh pair of pajama bottoms.  Jilleas descended the staircase where she found her grandmother sitting at the breakfast table with a bowl of fresh berries and crisp wafers.

Jilleas went about preparing one of the cucumber, mayonnaise and dill sandwiches which she so enjoyed.   She sat across from her grandmother, and through the course of the meal her grandmother asked, “Jilleas, would you like to go into town this day and travel to the market?”  Jilleas responded, saying, “Surely.”  And so her grandmother rummaged about and gave Jilleas three thank-you notes: one for the baker, one for the farmer, and one for the dairy farmer.

Once Jilleas finished her meal she called upon a puff of wind, which was really more of a pet.   And the puff of wind took her dishes and dropped them into the silken basin that held the water fairies.  Then Jilleas donned a straw cap and took up her twine bag that makes everything one-tenth its standard size, and she was on her way.

Jilleas traveled north along the clearing upon which she lives in a straw house with her grandmother, along the Sandy Path and then onto the cobblestone of the main township of the Mystical Realm Township and County.  And as she trod the cobblestone she saw the carpenter leaning against the fountain in the center of town with something she had never seen before.  The carpenter, seeing her fascination, waved her over.  As she came closer she could see that there were two wooden discs, with a string wrapped between them, and the other end of the string tied to one of his fingers.  The carpenter opened his hand and she saw the wooden discs go plummeting down as though they were going to crash into the earth, and then stop, and then move upwards once again, returning to the palm of his hand.  And it was as though there were fireworks exploding in the sky overhead.

Jilleas spoke, saying, “What is that that you have there?”  The carpenter responded, saying, “It is something that I fashioned out of spare bits of wood on my workroom floor, and I call it a yo-yo.   You may have heard that what goes up must come down, but when it comes to a yo-yo, what goes down must come up.”  And the carpenter rummaged about in one of his corduroy pockets, and he handed Jilleas a yo-yo of red wood that was bereft of string, wood harvested from the Maroon Forest, which is about a thousand days' journey north of the Mystical Realm Township and County.

It is said that should you touch even so much as a speck of soil upon which the trees of the Maroon Forest grow, that should you press a palm upon any manner of leafy tree, delectable fruit shall spring forth, and should you lower a pail into a well whose flow has dried, it shall come up brimming and bubbling, and a garment of thick wool shall wear as fine linen, and more besides.

Jilleas clasped the yo-yo of red wood, and she began to fantasize, and she fantasized so long that it ascended into her imagination, and she imagined so long that it ascended into a dream, and she dreamt so long that she felt she needed to bring that dream into the world.   And all this took place in the space of a single heartbeat, which is as long as a thousand years in our world.

And Jilleas's dream was this: to let the yo-yo of red wood fall from the tallest tower that was within her reach, that it may nearly touch the ground and then ascend, once more returning to the palm of her hand.

Jilleas then thanked the carpenter in the manner that the townspeople were often wont to do, and she continued on her way to the market, which is along the eastern portion of the main township.   And so she traveled north along the rounded stones, and she soon came to the stand of the baker.   The baker, who was placing warm loaves of crusty bread on a wide hearthstone, whose fragrance emanated throughout the Mystical Realm Township and County.

You may have heard tell that a person cannot live on bread alone.   However, this bread provides all the nourishment for which one could ever wish.

Jilleas procured such a loaf, and offered a thank-you note in exchange.   She continued farther north, and she soon came to the market stand of the farmer, whose wife was something of a free spirit.   She often went on adventures of her own, far and wide.  Though, when she did, buttercup flowers sprung up round about the farmhouse she shared with her husband.  She was currently on such an adventure.

The farmer had brought a bouquet of buttercups to market, and he gave a buttercup to Jilleas, and when she placed it on her tongue, its taste was as a pad of butter, and the texture became as the foam of the sea.

Jilleas curtsied, and he placed a hand upon his breast.  She asked after his wife, and one of the hairs across the top of his head stood, and it formed in the shape of a dove.   Jilleas then procured a jar of mayonnaise, as well as a basket of berries, and a bunch of cucumbers, for which she offered a thank-you note.

She was soon on her way once more, and continued north until she came to the stand of the dairy farmer, who was filling crystal jugs with milk that had a frothing layer of cream extending nearly to the lip.   The dairy farmer flipped one of the bottles whizzing through the air and handed it to Jilleas, and though there did not appear anything between the milk and her hands, the milk did not pour out.  And so Jilleas placed the jug into her twine bag that makes everything one-tenth its standard size, and she offered him a thank-you note.

Jilleas glided south, along the cobblestone of the main township and along the Sandy Path, and soon found herself on the clearing upon which she lives in a straw house with her grandmother.  She had heard tell that there was a queen spider in the Rickety Woods who weaves silk of the finest grade, that was, as far as anyone knew, indestructible.  She wished to procure such a strand for her yo-yo, so she traveled south into the Rickety Woods, round about the bare trees and through the Clean Swamp and the Dry Wood, until she came to a gathering of gemshard trees.  There the Queen Spider rested on a wide web, surrounded by all manner of creatures and critters who were native to that place.  And as Jilleas came upon the gathering of gemshard trees the Queen Spider spoke, saying, “Ah, Jilleas, but it is a glad day that brings you here once more.”

Jilleas, perplexed, responded saying, “But I've not been here ataul.”

The Queen Spider smiled, saying, “Very well then.”  And the creatures and critters surrounding her chattered and clapped.

The Queen Spider continued on, saying, “What then brings you here, young Jilleas?”

Jilleas responded, saying, “I fantasized so long that it ascended into my imagination, and I imagined so long that it ascended into a dream, and I dreamt so long that I felt I needed to bring that dream into the world.  And the dream is this: to let a yo-yo fall from the top of the tallest tower that is within my reach, that it may nearly strike the ground, and then ascend once more, returning to the palm of my hand.

      Would you be willing to provide a strand of the proper length?”

The Queen Spider swayed to and fro, and the many crowns atop her head jostled and clinked.   And the Queen Spider responded, saying, “Surely, though there is something I would ask of you.  There is a chill hugging the floor of the Rickety Woods that that makes my legs cold.  And so I would ask that you bring eight leg warmers to this, my royal court.”

And Jilleas, who had a mind for such matters, could see the path laid out before her, as clear as day.  And she responded, saying, “Surely.”

The Queen Spider spoke farther on, saying, “And you shall know that the strand is of the proper length, when it has emerged on the clearing upon which you live in a straw house with your grandmother.”

And so Jilleas proceeded north, through the Dry Wood, the Clean Swamp and round about the bare trees until she came upon the clearing once more.  And Jilleas sat upon the Resting Log, which is very near the Rickety Woods, that she might enjoy one of the cucumber, mayonnaise and dill sandwiches which she had packed.

The Resting Log, which was once the tallest and most beloved of all the trees in the Mystical Realm Township and County.  Through the seasons the tree was decorated with all manner of streamers and ornaments, and people would find comfort resting their backs upon the soft wood of its curves.  And the tree grew to love the people to such a degree that it wished to be closer to them.   So one day it bent over and it began to grow along the ground, and ever since, it has been referred to as the Resting Log.

Jilleas soon emerged from the Resting Log, and she traveled along the clearing, and along the Sandy Path, and came upon the cobblestone of the main township of the Mystical Realm Township and County.  And she traveled east toward the straw hut of the clothier.  The clothier, who was something of a hermit, but he always kept a boiling pot of water on the stove in the spirit of hospitality.

As Jilleas traveled she came across a mayberry bug traveling in the other direction.   She greeted the mayberry bug, and the mayberry bug did likewise.  And as they passed one another he took one of the mayberry seeds from his burlap sack and tossed it into the air, and it landed snugly into one of the pockets of her pajama bottoms.  It melted into her clothes, and all manner of red vine-like patterns played across the cloth, extending upward to her flannel shirt and even the straw hat which sat upon her head.

Jilleas soon found herself at the hut of the clothier, who, with ruddy demeanor, waved her in.  She sat at the stone table as he prepared two mugs of tea.  The clothier crushed various spices and herbs in his paws, and he poured water from a thick stoneware teapot into mugs, mugs which were fashioned from stone of the Azgul Quarry.

He plucked flowers from a vase and they twirled through the air, landing on the surface of the water.  And the clothier brought the mugs over, and he greeted her in the manner that the townspeople were often wont to do, and he said, “What then brings you here, young Jilleas?”

Jilleas gripped her hands around the mug, which was cool to the touch, as the herbs, spices and flora dissolved completely and utterly into its contents.  She hoisted the mug, and though boiling, the water was soothing to her lips.  And Jilleas spoke, saying, “Well, I fantasized so long that it ascended into my imagination, and I imagined so long that it ascended into a dream, and I dreamt so long that I felt that I needed to bring that dream into the world.

      And the dream is this: to let a yo-yo fall from the top of the tallest tower that is within my reach, that it may nearly touch the ground, and ascend once more, returning to the palm of my hand.”

The clothier ran his fingers through the cloth beard that adorned his face, and responded, saying, “Surely this is a worthwhile aim, though what would you ask of me?”

And Jilleas responded, saying, “Well, the Queen Spider is weaving a strand of the length I require, though she has requested that I procure for her eight leg warmers, for there is a chill that comes upon her legs in the Rickety Woods.”

The clothier spoke, saying, “I shall do as you wish, and I shall go one farther, for I shall knit a stocking cap for your grandmother.  And I shall go one farther beyond that, for I shall knit a pair of stocking leggings for you.

      Though there is something that I would ask of you.   On the dawn of your seventeenth birthday, I would like you to sing a song of your choosing.”

Jilleas stood up from the stone table, and she spun around, and for an instant it was as though she were lifting off the ground.  She responded, saying, “I shall do as you wish, and the song shall in some manner relate to those who tend the land.”

The clothier extended a paw and Jilleas extended a hand, and they clasped.  And as they did so a lightning dewdrop darted across his window, and flashes of light played across the thick red fur on his stout arms.

Jilleas was soon on her way once more, and the clothier stood at his hut waving, even as she traveled beyond the cobblestone of the main township.  She tread lightly upon stones of glass, circling to the west until she came to the northern portion of the Auberjeen Forest, and the residing place of the wizened old tree.  The wizened old tree, who holds lessons for creatures of every size and proportion and children of all ages, lessons on how to be well and how to grow in the promise of long-term happiness, wellbeing and fulfillment.  And as Jilleas came upon the residing place of the wizened old tree, a confetti of leaves burst forth from his hollow, all manner of kaleidoscopic hues as they were falling.

As they came to the ground they meshed and became as one, and Jilleas sat on the confetti of leaves, and found that wherever she placed pressure, they shone even more brilliantly than before.   She somersaulted and she cartwheeled, and she lay upon the soft leaves with her arms outstretched.

The wizened old tree addressed the gathering, and through the course of the afternoon he sent over saplings with a glass of moonberry juice, and those in attendance sipped the nectar as the saplings shuffled about.  Moonberry juice, which soothes every fear, and dispels every ill, and grants wings to the spirit, wings that may one day become wings that the whole world can see, upon which one may ascend to the Sky Kingdom insofar as one wishes.

As she sipped the moonberry juice she cast a luminous shadow in the shape of wings.

Jilleas then traveled farther west through the Auberjeen Forest to the gathering of trees whose branches are as vines, and she was grasped tenderly and tossed into the air, caught by one vine, and another and another and tossed once again, and once more, and she spun, and she stretched her arms as though she were gliding, breathing the strawberry air.  She cupped her hands and sent vibrations coursing through the air, and the trees rumbled.  The vines then picked her up and tossed her once again.

After catching her breath Jilleas traveled northeast to the bare tree stump.  The bare tree stump, which is as large as a city, yet as small as a thimble, a thimble as large as a city.  She sat upon its surface, and as she did so, she caught glimpse of creatures sprouting wings and ascending to the Sky Kingdom.   And as they peered from the Sky Kingdom, the Mystical Realm Township and County appeared as a gem the colors of autumn leaves, burgundy-gold and blazing orange and pomegranate and pale yellow, and that is why it is also called the Autumn Jewel.

Jilleas found that her eyelids were heavy, and she fell asleep as the light of the sun paled, though the light of the sun shines clearly, and is clearly visible in the Mystical Realm, even through the course of evening.  Jilleas awoke during the twinkling of the sands.  Then Jilleas called upon her morningray dove, and gave a packet of light to bring to the sun that read: “Please shine as though it were high noon.”  And the sun did so, and the light was glorious.

Jilleas was soon on her way once more, and she went through the forest, and along the glass stones, and south along the cobblestone of the main township of the Mystical Realm Township and County, and soon came to the hut of the clothier, who gave her eight leg warmers, a stocking cap for her grandmother, and a pair of stocking leggings for Jilleas.  She continued south along the Sandy Path and along the clearing, and as she came upon the clearing, she could see the glimmer of a silken strand just beginning to emerge.   She returned to the straw house in which she lives with her grandmother, and set the goods she had gathered at the marketplace upon the kitchen table.   Steam was arising from one of the silken basins, as licks of flame ran over the dishes, along the contours of the mugs, and along the ridges of the butter knives, and all manner of utensils.

Jilleas slung the twine bag about her shoulder that makes everything one-tenth its standard size, and she walked through the opening carved into the northern wall of the straw house.   And she traveled south along the clearing, and set about gathering up the silken strand as she went round about the bare trees, and through the Clean Swamp, and the Dry Wood, coming upon the residing place of the Queen Spider once more.

Jilleas greeted the Queen Spider in the manner that the townspeople were often wont to do, and she placed the sphere of silk into her twine bag that makes everything one-tenth its standard size.

The Queen Spider spoke, saying, “Ah, Jilleas, but it is a glad day that brings you here once more.”

And the various creatures and critters surrounding the Queen Spider formed a spindly line, and they placed the leg warmers from one to another, fitting each one snugly upon the Queen Spider's legs.   And when the eighth leg warmer was placed, the chill covering the floor of the Rickety Woods vanished, yet there remained an encircling mist around the Queen Spider herself.

And the Queen Spider spoke saying, “Go then, Jilleas, go then and live your crazy dream.”

Jilleas responded, saying, “It is not a crazy dream, for it is a dream that I can bring into the world.”

And the creatures and the critters applauded Jilleas, and the glimmer that shone from deep within the gem shards of the gemshard trees came nearer to the surface, and the light of the gems set in the many crowns atop the Queen Spider's head pulsed.

The Queen Spider then tipped her head, and one of her many crowns tumbled through the air, and along the ground, and it struck a pebble, leaping through the air, as it landed into the twine bag upon Jilleas's shoulder.  And the creatures and the critters of the Rickety Woods circled the wide web upon which the Queen Spider rested, and her cheeks became the color of rose.

Jilleas spun about, thanking the Queen Spider.  She traveled north once more through the Dry Wood and the Clean Swamp and round about the bare trees, and once she had come upon the clearing she tread the southern portion of the Auberjeen Forest, which wraps around the western edge of the Mystical Realm Township and County.  She soon found herself standing before the cast-iron spire of the Felleye Tower.  The Felleye Tower, which is so named, for it is said that a mighty creature once lumbered 'neath its arches.

And so Jilleas climbed the Felleye Tower, past the bark of the trees of the Auberjeen Forest, through the canopy of the trees, through the sky, through the clouds, through the azure blue gradient and the billowing white cloud of smoke, until she came upon the landing.  The landing, which is nearly within reach of the Sky Kingdom.  And she tied one end of the silken strand to one of her fingers, and the other end to the yo-yo of red wood, and she let it go plummeting down.  And it went through the billowing white cloud of smoke and the azure blue gradient and the clouds and the sky and the canopy, past the bark of the trees of the Auberjeen Forest, and it came to an abrupt halt, a rest.

And it was as though Jilleas's heart had become arrested.

Then, an earthworm emerged from the soil, whose head is its tail and whose tail is its head.  And the earthworm arched as it slithered over to the yo-yo: slinkity-slink, slinkity-slink.  The pinkity-slink stood, and it nudged the yo-yo, and the yo-yo went soaring upwards as fast as though it were falling, past the bark of the trees of the Auberjeen Forest and through the canopy, through the sky and through the clouds, through the azure blue gradient, through the billowing white cloud of smoke as it began to slow, and slow, and slow.

And the spinning wooden discs returned to her outstretched palm, and she closed her fingers around the yo-yo.

Jilleas sighed, and the sigh bounded along the air, and it caught the wind, and it became the wind, and it traveled around the world, until it returned, tousling the hair on the back of her head.  And her grandmother, upon whose visage was a somewhat dour expression, well, her lips curled upwards around the edges, though she was unsure as to why.  And the fireworks that Jilleas had seen when the yo-yo had first met her eyes became real fireworks, fireworks that the whole world could see.

And Jilleas could see that all is peace,

All is well.


The beginning.
story_txt: Hello, I've put up this page because I'd like to raise $500-$1000 to be set aside in a fund for costs relating to car maintenance and/or housing.   The car is a 2003 Toyota Camry as pictured.   Anyone who donates will receive a signed copy of the fairy tale “What Goes Down Must Come Up”, which I've also included below, as well as an audio rendition of the tale. Take care and be well,Jeremy            ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------What Goes Down Must Come Up:Jilleas and the Yo-Yo A Song  Breath on the Wind Jilleas awoke as the sun crept through the eastern window of her bedroom in the straw house she shared with her grandmother.   The straw house, whose body is composed of firm straw, and whose roof is laid with lighter straw.   She sat up, and she stretched out her arms as the light continued to rise, tickling her eyelids open.   She then went to wash up and returned to her room to don a flannel shirt and a fresh pair of pajama bottoms.   Jilleas descended the staircase where she found her grandmother sitting at the breakfast table with a bowl of fresh berries and crisp wafers. Jilleas went about preparing one of the cucumber, mayonnaise and dill sandwiches which she so enjoyed.   She sat across from her grandmother, and through the course of the meal her grandmother asked, “Jilleas, would you like to go into town this day and travel to the market?”   Jilleas responded, saying, “Surely.”   And so her grandmother rummaged about and gave Jilleas three thank-you notes: one for the baker, one for the farmer, and one for the dairy farmer. Once Jilleas finished her meal she called upon a puff of wind, which was really more of a pet.   And the puff of wind took her dishes and dropped them into the silken basin that held the water fairies.   Then Jilleas donned a straw cap and took up her twine bag that makes everything one-tenth its standard size, and she was on her way. Jilleas traveled north along the clearing upon which she lives in a straw house with her grandmother, along the Sandy Path and then onto the cobblestone of the main township of the Mystical Realm Township and County.   And as she trod the cobblestone she saw the carpenter leaning against the fountain in the center of town with something she had never seen before.   The carpenter, seeing her fascination, waved her over.   As she came closer she could see that there were two wooden discs, with a string wrapped between them, and the other end of the string tied to one of his fingers.   The carpenter opened his hand and she saw the wooden discs go plummeting down as though they were going to crash into the earth, and then stop, and then move upwards once again, returning to the palm of his hand.   And it was as though there were fireworks exploding in the sky overhead. Jilleas spoke, saying, “What is that that you have there?”   The carpenter responded, saying, “It is something that I fashioned out of spare bits of wood on my workroom floor, and I call it a yo-yo.   You may have heard that what goes up must come down, but when it comes to a yo-yo, what goes down must come up.”   And the carpenter rummaged about in one of his corduroy pockets, and he handed Jilleas a yo-yo of red wood that was bereft of string, wood harvested from the Maroon Forest, which is about a thousand days' journey north of the Mystical Realm Township and County. It is said that should you touch even so much as a speck of soil upon which the trees of the Maroon Forest grow, that should you press a palm upon any manner of leafy tree, delectable fruit shall spring forth, and should you lower a pail into a well whose flow has dried, it shall come up brimming and bubbling, and a garment of thick wool shall wear as fine linen, and more besides. Jilleas clasped the yo-yo of red wood, and she began to fantasize, and she fantasized so long that it ascended into her imagination, and she imagined so long that it ascended into a dream, and she dreamt so long that she felt she needed to bring that dream into the world.   And all this took place in the space of a single heartbeat, which is as long as a thousand years in our world. And Jilleas's dream was this: to let the yo-yo of red wood fall from the tallest tower that was within her reach, that it may nearly touch the ground and then ascend, once more returning to the palm of her hand. Jilleas then thanked the carpenter in the manner that the townspeople were often wont to do, and she continued on her way to the market, which is along the eastern portion of the main township.   And so she traveled north along the rounded stones, and she soon came to the stand of the baker.   The baker, who was placing warm loaves of crusty bread on a wide hearthstone, whose fragrance emanated throughout the Mystical Realm Township and County. You may have heard tell that a person cannot live on bread alone.   However, this bread provides all the nourishment for which one could ever wish. Jilleas procured such a loaf, and offered a thank-you note in exchange.   She continued farther north, and she soon came to the market stand of the farmer, whose wife was something of a free spirit.   She often went on adventures of her own, far and wide.   Though, when she did, buttercup flowers sprung up round about the farmhouse she shared with her husband.   She was currently on such an adventure. The farmer had brought a bouquet of buttercups to market, and he gave a buttercup to Jilleas, and when she placed it on her tongue, its taste was as a pad of butter, and the texture became as the foam of the sea. Jilleas curtsied, and he placed a hand upon his breast.   She asked after his wife, and one of the hairs across the top of his head stood, and it formed in the shape of a dove.   Jilleas then procured a jar of mayonnaise, as well as a basket of berries, and a bunch of cucumbers, for which she offered a thank-you note. She was soon on her way once more, and continued north until she came to the stand of the dairy farmer, who was filling crystal jugs with milk that had a frothing layer of cream extending nearly to the lip.   The dairy farmer flipped one of the bottles whizzing through the air and handed it to Jilleas, and though there did not appear anything between the milk and her hands, the milk did not pour out.   And so Jilleas placed the jug into her twine bag that makes everything one-tenth its standard size, and she offered him a thank-you note. Jilleas glided south, along the cobblestone of the main township and along the Sandy Path, and soon found herself on the clearing upon which she lives in a straw house with her grandmother.   She had heard tell that there was a queen spider in the Rickety Woods who weaves silk of the finest grade, that was, as far as anyone knew, indestructible.   She wished to procure such a strand for her yo-yo, so she traveled south into the Rickety Woods, round about the bare trees and through the Clean Swamp and the Dry Wood, until she came to a gathering of gemshard trees.   There the Queen Spider rested on a wide web, surrounded by all manner of creatures and critters who were native to that place.   And as Jilleas came upon the gathering of gemshard trees the Queen Spider spoke, saying, “Ah, Jilleas, but it is a glad day that brings you here once more.” Jilleas, perplexed, responded saying, “But I've not been here ataul.” The Queen Spider smiled, saying, “Very well then.”   And the creatures and critters surrounding her chattered and clapped. The Queen Spider continued on, saying, “What then brings you here, young Jilleas?” Jilleas responded, saying, “I fantasized so long that it ascended into my imagination, and I imagined so long that it ascended into a dream, and I dreamt so long that I felt I needed to bring that dream into the world.   And the dream is this: to let a yo-yo fall from the top of the tallest tower that is within my reach, that it may nearly strike the ground, and then ascend once more, returning to the palm of my hand.           Would you be willing to provide a strand of the proper length?” The Queen Spider swayed to and fro, and the many crowns atop her head jostled and clinked.   And the Queen Spider responded, saying, “Surely, though there is something I would ask of you.  There is a chill hugging the floor of the Rickety Woods that that makes my legs cold.   And so I would ask that you bring eight leg warmers to this, my royal court.” And Jilleas, who had a mind for such matters, could see the path laid out before her, as clear as day.   And she responded, saying, “Surely.” The Queen Spider spoke farther on, saying, “And you shall know that the strand is of the proper length, when it has emerged on the clearing upon which you live in a straw house with your grandmother.” And so Jilleas proceeded north, through the Dry Wood, the Clean Swamp and round about the bare trees until she came upon the clearing once more.   And Jilleas sat upon the Resting Log, which is very near the Rickety Woods, that she might enjoy one of the cucumber, mayonnaise and dill sandwiches which she had packed. And the spinning wooden discs returned to her outstretched palm, and she closed her fingers around the yo-yo. Jilleas sighed, and the sigh bounded along the air, and it caught the wind, and it became the wind, and it traveled around the world, until it returned, tousling the hair on the back of her head.   And her grandmother, upon whose visage was a somewhat dour expression, well, her lips curled upwards around the edges, though she was unsure as to why.   And the fireworks that Jilleas had seen when the yo-yo had first met her eyes became real fireworks, fireworks that the whole world could see. And Jilleas could see that all is peace, All is well.   The beginning.

story:
The UX4 Kit is a set of four steel brackets that lets you turn 2x4s into endless variations of quality custom furniture. Choose your height, pick your surface, paint all over it, we want to see what you can do with your UX4 Kit. 


All living spaces are not created equal, as many of us know from experience. The UX4 Kit was designed to fit any nook and cranny that needs a surface. Whether you have a tiny studio, a sprawling loft, or your mom’s guest room, The UX4 Kit is the most versatile way to furnish your space.

The UX4 steel brackets have a whopping weight capacity of up to 400 lbs, allowing you to make dining tables and shared workspaces. 2x4s are the most common building materials in the country, used for things like framing an entire house, so yeah, we’re confident your UX4 furniture will last.

Well-designed furniture usually comes with a hefty price tag. We want to bring this innovative kit to the people, not the select few, so our number one priority was keeping the price accessible without sacrificing versatility and style. With endless possibilities and quality you can trust, your UX4 purchase will bring value to your home for years to come.


The UX4 Bracket Kit includes 4 steel, powder coated (or raw steel) brackets, the hardware, and guidelines for assembly. Screw any standard 2x4 into each bracket, choose a good surface, attach your bracketed legs with the screws, and you have yourself a table!

Below you'll find a quick guide to a couple common furniture pieces and the needed 2x4 leg lengths to build them. Keep in mind, the recommended leg lengths add a couple of inches to accommodate angled 2x4 legs.

Any contribution you can make is greatly appreciated! With your support, we can bring this design to the people as a SWENYO product, while keeping costs low. Whether you want a simple or complex project, The UX4 Kit lets you create your own customized piece of modern furniture at an affordable price. 

SWENYO is a new online home goods brand and retailer located in sunny Encinitas, CA. Dedicated to inspiring creative living in personal spaces, our small team of 9 has been working towards bringing you premium products that embrace style and function for today's consumer.

We've recently implemented a Design Partnership program that works with talented designers like Ben Uyeda to constantly bring our customers innovative products while supporting the design community.

The UX4 is our first crowdfunded project, but we hope to bring products like the UX4 to the crowdfunding community 4 or 5 times a year with your support.

When we first spoke with Ben about SWENYO and our philosophy, it was immediately apparent that we were on the same page. Why does modern furniture have to either be expensive or low-quality? The answer is, it doesn't. Ben already had the idea for the UX4, but teaming up to bring this product to the lovely people of Indiegogo made it a reality.

We want to give a big thanks to all of our supporters and backers who stand behind good design, quality products, and cool people doing cool things :) Stay tuned for campaign updates with extra tips, design ideas, and our progress! 


Lets be friends, follow us!

Facebook / Instagram / Pinterest / Twitter

UX4 Photography by Kim Marcelo

Special thanks to Ben Uyeda! 

Risks and Challenges

SWENYO has already been working with a high quality manufacturer and there could be changes in commodity prices but we're very confident we can deliver the UX4. We've already built 3-4 versions of prototypes, tested development, and are ready for the production run.

SWENYO has been designing and manufacturing home goods products for two years so your money is in good hands!

story:
http://www.box-sox.com/

GREETINGS TO ALL GIFT GIVERS!

My name is Whitney Cochran. I’m a momprenuer and mother of four living in Newark, Delaware. I experienced a revelation while wrapping Christmas presents for my daughters two years ago. Surrounded by dozens of presents and endless rolls of wrapping paper, I looked around and thought to myself, there must be a quicker and more ecofriendly solution to gift wrapping.  In the midst of that moment, I created 

BoxSox Reusable Gift Wrap! 




WHAT IS BOXSOX?

BoxSox is a reusable, stretchable, fabric gift wrap made from spandex. BoxSox comes in five convenient sizes, and can also be purchased in a pack of three. Each BoxSox comes with an attached ribbon, a gift box, tissue paper, and a card. You simply slip the BoxSox over the box, tie the ribbon, and you’re done! It’s giftwrapping made simple, fast, easy, stress-free, and eco-friendly. 


THINKING OUTSIDE OF THE BOX(SOX)

BoxSox does not aim to eliminate the use of traditional paper wrap, but rather provide a more eco-friendly gift wrapping option. Our world is constantly coming up with new ways to help save the earth, and BoxSox is one of those ways. By wrapping a gift in BoxSox, you are encouraging someone else to use BoxSox when they give a gift; as a result, an eco-friendly re-wrapping cycle begins! It's a gift wrapping revolution!

Not only is BoxSox eco-friendly, but it also saves a lot of time and resources. Instead of going through the trouble of finding wrapping paper, tissue paper, scissors, tape, and a card, you can simply use BoxSox, the all-in-one solution to gift wrapping! People will spend less time wrapping, and more time enjoying the excitement that comes with giving a gift. 

BoxSox is also extremely easy to use and looks great every time, making it a great product for those "not so gifted" gift wrappers out there. 






HELP US REVOLUTIONIZE GIFT GIVING

By donating to BoxSox, you will be assisting us on our journey towards making reusable, stretchable gift wrap a commonly used product. With your help, we will be able to work towards company growth, better marketing, productivity, and most importantly, being able to further our dream of saving precious time and resources one gift at a time.


HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!

We at BoxSox appreciate any kind of help we can get. You can help us get the BoxSox name out there by following our social media platforms, hashtagging #BOXSOX, and of course by using the old-fashioned "word of mouth" method! Consider yourselves members of the BoxSox Social Media & Marketing Team ( :

Follow @BoxSoxOfficial on Twitter & Instagram!

https://twitter.com/boxsoxofficial

http://instagram.com/boxsoxofficial


Like "BoxSox" on Facebook! 

https://www.facebook.com/BoxSox

Follow us on Pinterest! 

http://pinterest.com/boxsoxofficial/boards/

story:
Planter, re-imagined. 

 

 

 

A New Experience 

 

Livi is a vivid creature that reimagines the way we relate to plants! We believe that by reimagining the most ordinary everyday products in innovative ways, we can create treasured experiences that enhance our environment and impact our well-being. That is why we created Livi (patent pending)—a colorful creature that reimagines the way we experience and relate to our plants. Livi is a versatile portable planter for virtually any vertical surface.

 

Livi does not require any assembly and is ready to attach to a window (or other surface) in your home or office with a gentle push. Inspired by nature, Livi’s micro-suction palms are made of an innovative nanotechnology material that is able to bond with smooth surfaces repeatedly, including windows!

 

 

 

 

 

Press:

 

 

You visit our PR page at here

 

Why Livi?

 

We believe that many people view plants as static decorations, relegated to the corner of a room, table, or window ledge. We want to change this perception. By reimagining the commonplace planter as a playful animated creature, we sought to create a more engaging and pleasurable experience with plants and flowers. Although Livi may be small and compact, it can have a big impact by enhancing the way we live, work, and play.

 

 

 

 

 

Bring Outside In:

 

Livi makes it possible to grow our favorite plants virtually everywhere. No more worries about whether indoor light is too dim or your home lacks window ledges for plants. Simply stick Livi to your window and bring the natural world inside!

How does it work? 

•  Remove the protective film from Livi’s palms (micro-suction)

•  Simply place a size-appropriate planter pot inside Livi. (Alternatively, you can fill Livi with nutrient-rich soil and then directly plant your flowers, herbs or greenery within.)

•  Stick Livi to your window. Enjoy adorning your windows and turning them into a beautiful vertical garden.

 

Colors + Stretch Goals:

•  The Campaign Starts with Medow Colors (Jasmine, Sunflower, Lime, Aqua)

•  Stretch Goal 1 will unlock two more colors (Orange, Lavender)

•  Stretch Goal 2 will unlock addition two colors (Serenity Blue, Rose)

 

 

 

 

Design Process:

 

We aspired to design a new experience with plants. To realize our vision we undertook an interdisciplinary approach involving product design, user experience design, as well as landscape and architecture design. We actively sought to answer essential questions: What is a planter now vs. what a planter could be? How can a planter change our appreciation of plants and our behaviors toward them? How could a planter turn a plant into something more consequential? These questions are not trivial. They provided a starting point for rethinking the role of both plant and planter in our everyday lives.

In designing a prototype, we made hundreds of sketches and produced 32 different design iterations of Livi. Eventually, we 3D printed several dozen prototypes and carefully painted them to study color variations.

Since we believe that great design is a shared, participatory experience between designers and users, we approached this human-centered design strategy very seriously. We invited many different groups of people to engage with our prototypes for several weeks, and encouraged them to provide feedback throughout the process. Although the end-goal is the design of a great product, we are just as interested in enhancing people's lives at home or in the workplace by engaging with greenery through Livi.

Livi can hold a variety of plants and has a capacity of up to 10oz (17.5 cubicinches, 275cc), which allows for planting a variety of greenery and herbs, or displaying your favorite flowers. You can also simply insert a small planter pot directly in Livi. 

 

Manufacturing

We are thrilled with all the possibilities Livi can offer. Livi’s design involves complex curvature forms and geometry. We spent literally hundreds of hours consulting with designers, technicians, and manufacturers from North America, Europe, and Asia for the smoothest and best manufacturing results. We sent out digital models and 3D printed prototypes to manufacturers, and either met them face-to-face or communicated with them to review the entire process. The manufacturing process involves an injection molding technique that uses a resin (acrylonitrile butadiene styrene) that is 100% recyclable. The process includes:

•  Mold design 

•  Mold tooling 

•  Sample production 

•  Production Run 

•   Assembly (attaching microsuction pads on livi’s palms).

•  After a great deal of research, we are excited to share that we have partnered with a great manufacturer, and are passionately waiting to start the process!

Microscution Pads:

Livi's palms are made of micro-suction pads using an innovative nanotechnology process developed in Japan.

Livi sticks to smooth, even, clean, and dry surface. Micro-suction pads function like suction cups, but at the microscopic level. Micro-suction tapes have hundreds of microscopic air pockets that create a vacuum once they are pressed against smooth surfaces, creating a bond. That’s why it’s so important to clean the surface prior to affixing Livi so that dirt/dust particles do not affect the micro-suction pads. When removing Livi from surfaces, please do so gently since rapid removal may result in tearing and damaging the micro-suction pads—thus weakening the bonding power of Livi’s pads. Do not use Livi in areas that are wet and too humid (bathrooms or sauna) because microscopic water particles will lower or remove its adsorption force. In case you want to stick Livi to a new surface, we do recommend cleaning both the new surface and the pads by wiping the micro-suction off with a damp cloth to remove the dust and let it completely dry. Once dry, the suction power will be restored. If the micro-suction pads are not well maintained (get dirty, absorb dust particles, or tear due to rapid removal from surfaces), it loses its function and won't re-adhere to surfaces properly and there is a chance that Livi will drop from the surface. We have tested micro-suction pads on our own prototypes for several months and those that are well-maintained are functioning properly. We have not tested the micro-suction tape beyond 12 months and have relied on the the manufacturer/supplier specifications. Our supply of micro-suction pads come with a protection film, and since we won't remove the film we will not test them individually, so we don't guarantee any possible malfunction resulting from micro-suction pads.

Responsible Manufacturing: 

 Livi is committed to social and environmental sustainability. We are pleased to say that the entire manufacturing process is socially responsible, resulting in a resin material that is also fully recyclable!

 

About Us:

The Livi team is dedicated to developing new ways in which we as humans can incorporate plants and ecological systems into the built environment. Livi is our pet project, which emerged from an afternoon brain-storming session and made us all excited.

 

 

We share passion for our new pet project, Livi.  We aim to reimagine the way the humans interact with the greenery and plants in the built environment and cities. 

 

Hooman Koliji 

Hooman is an architect, landscape designer, and educator. He is passionate about exploring imaginative solutions for critical problems. His work on Ecological Design Thinking has yielded several innovative design research projects.

Parsa Shirazi 

Parsa is a designer and experienced architect. After years of practicing architecture, graphic design, and teaching, Parsa pursued User Experience Design (UX) and Interaction Design and poured all of his experience and passion into the user experience.

Yildirim Yazgaranikan 

 Yildirim is a designer with a background in architecture, product design, and technology. He is passionate about finding intelligent ways to solve complex problems.

Mandana Parvinian

Mandana is a landscape designer and an architect based in San Francisco Bay Area. She is interested in creating meaningful and well-crafted design.

Risks and challenges

If we are funded successfully, we expect a smooth production process. It must be said, however, that manufacturing in large scale has the potential to present some inherent challenges. A critical point in our process is the Design for Mold (DFM) stage, which sometimes requires minor design modifications to ensure manufacturability and quality production. In fact, we made several design revisions to our initial production run to address "undercut" areas and the “side pulling action” of the mold during the injection molding process. Accordingly, we addressed these issues during our “pre-DRM phase.”

Also, we wanted to guarantee that post-injection molding would not result in any deformation of Livi’s hands or legs. Our manufacturing partner solved this issue by using specialized resins with additives, as well as increasing the cycle time to eliminate that risk. With respect to this issue, we do not foresee any major problems ahead; we are also confident that any minor issues that might arise during the manufacturing process can be easily mitigated.

Color mixing in plastic injection mold is a challenge, but always achievable. Manufacturers simply mix color pigments to achieve the desired hue. Our manufacturing partner will use the Pantone color code to match production colors to our design specifications. Prior to full production we will receive several sample color runs to review and approve, thereby ensuring that the final colors will match to color selection.

We feel confident in stating that we have minimized possible risks by consulting with manufacturing experts and our manufacturing partner through numerous back-and-forth exchanges throughout the design and manufacturing process.

In summary, we feel that we are well on our way to the beginning of an exciting adventure with Livi!

For more information please visit Livi's page at http://livi.creodes.com

story:
Shock Top donates $62,000 to increase EvaDrop distribution!

 

Yes, you’re reading that correctly! We’ve teamed up with Shock Top Brewing Co. in their Shock the Drought initiative to help save even more water! Shock Top will be matching our Indiegogo earnings in order to help us build more EvaDrop Smart Showers! And that’s not all…we’ll also be offering 100 EvaDrop’s at a discounted rate of $99 AND we’ll be donating 600 units to an organization of your choice - yes, you!

 

Check out the details below to find out how you can nominate an organization you think would benefit from EvaDrop.

 

Help EvaDrop Smart Shower “Shock the Drought”

 

Americans use more than 1.2 trillion gallons of water every year showering. EvaDrop is the world's first water-saving smart shower that can trim water usage in half. With California in its fourth year of severe drought, Shock Top saw an opportunity to help Shock the Drought through EvaDrop's innovative solution to water conservation. The brand is providing $62,000 in funds to help get EvaDrop into more showers. There are two ways you help EvaDrop to Shock the Drought:

1) Buy an EvaDrop at a discounted rate - just $99. Check out our perks to claim your EvaDrop!

2) Nominate an organization, cause or group that would benefit from EvaDrop. We're giving away 600 EvaDrops for free to worthy groups across the state of California and we need your help to find great causes out there! Whether it's a school, a non-profit organization, low-income housing or any other worthy groups, please visit our website and let us know where we should donate.

 

 

 

Eva is a smart shower device that saves up to 50% of your water usage, while maintaining an enjoyable shower experience. 

 

 

 
Features include:
  • Eva shuts off your water flow once your desired temperature is reached making sure no water is wasted before you get in.
  • A unique sensor system that adjusts the water flow based off your needs.
  • A timer that notifies you when you are taking too long of a shower.

 

 

Controlled by our specialized smartphone app, Eva can be calibrated to fit different showers, shower heads and user preferences. The app can also track your water usage, habits and savings; providing you with valuable information that can help you learn and conserve even more.  With data from thousands of Evas feeding into the app, you will be able to compare your usage with other users, as well as track the trends and changes in water consumption of the entire Eva community.

 

Eva in the Press

"This Gizmo wants to make your shower 'smart', cutting your water use in half" - Entrepreneur Magazine

"Many parts of the world are experiencing the most debilitating water crises in recent history... Perhaps most people don’t talk about it because they don’t feel like much can be done. For this reason, the creators give you the chance to play your part with the Eva Smart Shower." - Venture Beat

"It's a new gadget that can help you save big when it comes to your water bill" - ABC7 Detroit  

 

When you are directly underneath the shower head, wetting your hair or rinsing off soap, Eva sets your water flow to 100%. Providing you with a strong water flow right when you need it.

When you step away from the shower, shampooing your hair or scrubbing your body, Eva reduces the water flow; still keeping you nice and warm.

When you are further away from the shower, shaving your legs or anything else outside the flow of water, Eva reduces the water even more.  Simple and automatic.

 

 

Eva begins tracking your water temperature from the moment your shower is turned on. Once the water reaches your desired temperature, Eva shuts off the flow of water and notifies you that your shower is ready; assuring you don’t waste any water.

 

 

Set your desired shower goals and Eva will track, remind and lead you to a more water conscious shower experience.

 

Eva automatically throttles water flow from 0% - 100% and everything in between. Saving water when its not needed, while maintaining an enjoyable shower experience.

 

Eva is designed to work with 90% of showers and shower heads.  Using standard 1/2” pipe fittings, Eva is mounted between your wall and shower head. Modern and sleek, Eva looks great in every shower.

 

 

 

Eva can be calibrated for an optimal shower experience, fitting any personal preferences or needs

 

Free specialized app provides you with comprehensive shower statistics, showing water usage habits and allowing comparison with the Eva community. Helping users learn and discover how to improve their water conservation efforts.

 

Eva Smart Shower pays for itself in less than a year.

With the average price of water rising and majority of household water waste being in the shower, Eva will be able to pay for itself within a year of use. Eva's affordable price and water saving capabilities will prove to be an investment for the future.

 

 

The Cause / Inspiration

 

We believe, now more than ever, society needs to change its view on water consumption. The Eva team combined the power of technology with the sensibility of conservation to create a concept with the potential to make a significant impact on water usage with these principles in mind:

 

  • Water Crisis

Countries all over the world are currently in some of the worst drought conditions in history, experiencing "exceptional" drought conditions - the harshest on a five-level scale. Consequences of this high level of drought include: exceptional and widespread crop/pasture losses and shortages of water in reservoirs, streams, and wells, creating water emergencies. According to the International Water Management Institute, the world can expect more extreme weather and rising numbers in the world's population, which will dramatically increase a demand for water. 

  • Smart Technology

Equipped with a specialized free mobile app, Eva gives users a more personalized way to shower. Through bluetooth technology, the Eva app is able to provide comprehensive shower statistics that allow you to track your water conservation efforts and compare results with the rest of the Eva community. An advanced algorithm also allows the shower’s sensor system to determine the amount of water used during a shower, while maintaining a high quality experience.

  • Shower Experience

 

Breakthrough Eva technology introduces users to a whole new way of showering. This high-tech mechanism features a desired temperature setting, unique sensor system that throttles water flow based off user’s needs, and a timer reminding users when their shower is too long.  

Eva's temperature shut off is one of the biggest water saving components of the device. Waiting just 30 seconds for your shower to warm up can equal a gallon of water wasted. With Eva, your shower will cut off water flow once your desired water temperature is reached. So if you turn on your shower and walk away to brush your teeth or make the bed, you won't have to worry about wasting any water.

  • Knowledge and Awareness

Providing Eva users with a simple, easy solution to conserve water is our way of shifting the way society views water consumption. With smart shower app statistics that bring daily awareness to users, we continue the cycle of revolutionizing the practice of water conservation, inspiring smart shower users to explore other ways of saving water and bettering the world.

 

 

Tech Specs

 

 

 

 

Interesting Facts

 

  • The average shower is 9 minutes long, using an estimated 19 gallons of water per shower.
         - Using Eva can save up to 9.5 gallons/ shower

  • With 316.1 million people in the U.S., we are averaging 6 billion gallons of shower water per day.
         - Eva could save the U.S. 3 billion gallons of water per day

  • The U.S. uses an average of 2.2 trillion gallons of shower water per year.
         - Eva could save the U.S. over a trillion gallons of water every year.

  • On average, people spend half of their shower time away from the showerhead; shampooing, body washing, shaving, etc...

  • Due to drought, the cost of water has been rising rapidly in the past few years, and is quickly becoming one of a household’s costliest utility bills. Showers are one of the top contributors to a high water bill.
     

Indiegogo Perks

Here's a breakdown of the perks you can choose from when you support this campaign (select your perk from the sidebar at the top of this page).

 

 

 

Want a free Eva?

 

Eva Club Referral Program

Receive a free Eva Smart Shower by referring our campaign to your friends and family! All you have to do is share our campaign using your custom Indiegogo link.

How it works.

 

Simply log in to Indiegogo, if you have not already, or create an account by signing up here. Be sure to use the same account you used when you purchased your Eva. Then, look below our main video at the top of this page for buttons to share and copy your Unique URL.
 

Post around the internet and save if for later by clicking the link icon, or begin sharing on social media by simply clicking the Facebook or Twitter buttons above with your URL pre-loaded.

Get creative!

LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR REFERRAL PROGRAM HERE 

 

 

We have decided that as a water conservation device and company, it is our duty to give back and support the areas in the world most affected by water shortage.

We have listed the areas around the world most affected by droughts, as well as  the organizations that are in place to support that area’s water conservation. 
(List Here)

If you live in one of these areas most in need of water conservation and purchase an Eva Smart Shower between now and the end of our campaign, we will donate $5 to the water conservation organization in your area.

To learn more about our #GivingTuesday efforts and to check out if your area is on our water conservation needs list visit: http://evasmartshower.com/givingtuesday

 

Team

 

 

 

Torrey Tayenaka
Lead Product

LinkedIn

Haris Karim
Strategy & Business Dev

 

Dalip Jaggi
Digital & App

LinkedIn

 

 

Our Eva Smart Shower collaborators have come together from a variety of different professional backgrounds, ranging from strategic pros to artistic minds. The driving force behind Eva consists of seven key players in marketing, video, design, web and mobile, and public relations. In addition to our core team, we have partnered with professionally known engineers, designers and industry experts to create our revolutionary device.

FAQ

 

Can I set up Eva on my own?

Yes, Eva is designed for an easy home installation with very little tools needed and no cutting open of your walls.

What are the Shipping Costs?

All shipping in the US is free of charge. There is additional cost for international shipping. Shipment does not include extra fees from customs, or additional costs associated with your country. If it turns out that shipment to your country proves impossible, we will reimburse your order.

When are the Evas shipping?

We are excited to say that we are in our final stages of engineering. We will be gearing up for our first manufacturing run soon. A defined date will be provided within a few months. Our team is pushing hard to deliver EvaDrop to our supporters as soon as possible.

How is Eva powered?

Currently Eva is powered by a 9V battery that we anticipate lasting over a year before needing to be replaced.  We are also developing energy reducing features as well as a possible microturbine that could potentially make Eva's battery last much longer.

 

Does Eva fit my shower?

Eva is designed to fit 90% of showers and shower heads. It uses the standard 1/2" connections that a standard shower head has.  If you have further questions on whether or not your shower head is supported by Eva, you can email a photograph of your shower to photos@evasmartshower.com 

 

Will Eva be providing 1/2" pipe extensions to account for the shower arm pipes that vary in depth? 

Yes, we will be shipping a few different length 1/2" pipes to ensure that Eva will screw on flush up against the shower wall. 

 

How can I contact Eva Smart Shower directly?

You may contact us by email, eva@evasmartshower.com or visit our contact page on our website at www.evasmartshower.com/contact
