No matter who you are, the Octave Light R1 helps you easily turn your inspirations into reality.



Before we go to the Q&A section, please click here to download the pdf file of the bonus gifts, when the pre-sales orders exceeds certain volumes. These are attractive gifts. So, here are even more reasons to share the news on the Octave Light R1.


And here is the first video we every publicly posted, on 15th Feb, 2016. It is a bit long, and our video shooting skills certainly improved a lot within one month.


Questions and Answers Section:

1. How does the Octave Light R1 3D printer compare to others?

Please click here to download the pdf file of comparison. I promise an entertaining read.


2. How about software?

The computer software that is distributed with the Octave Light R1, is called Octave Light App. It is written from the ground up by my software engineer. Our software is right now in alpha stage. It will be ready in two months, when we are shipping out the Octave Light R1.

Here is a bit of history on how our computer software came to be. The full source code of a computer software called UVDLPSlicerController, was licensed to me by the original author of UVDLPSlicerController, in May 2015. In June of 2015, I emailed the author saying that I would like to pay him to distribute his software. But the author replied saying that they "are currently not accepting any new clients". So, I made the decision of totally abandoning that UVDLPSlicerController computer software. And started hiring my own full-time software engineer in July 2015 to write our own computer software called the Octave Light App, from scratch. We have worked on our own independent piece of computer software for 8 months now.

The Octave Light App is easy to use and powerful. It is going to be a free download from our website, when the R1 is shipping. So you can download the latest software upgrade from our website regularly. And every month you will get new features and improvements to the software, for free.

The firmware of the R1 is packaged inside the Octave Light App too. So, when you are upgrading the Octave Light App, you can conveniently upgrade the firmware inside the R1 over the USB cable, by clicking a few buttons. The firmware inside the prototypes is written by me. The firmware inside the final mass production version of the R1 is written by my electrical engineer and me, using industrially proven components, including the FreeRTOS. (By the way, we design and layout the printed circuit boards of the R1, in-house.)

Here are some of the planned features of the Octave Light App:
  • Functions to help you conveniently determine the optimum ultraviolet light intensity and exposure time, for any resin you put into the Octave Light R1.
  • Functions to guide you through the initial setup and preparation of the Octave Light R1.
  • Basic features like resizing, rotating, duplicating, and positioning 3D models within the build volume.
  • Basic features like importing mesh based 3D file formats, e.g. STL and OBJ.
  • Direct importing of parametric solid modeling file formats, e.g. STEP and IGES. Engineers and Industrial Designers would love this feature. Solid modeling do not have the inaccuracy of the mesh based formats.
  • Auto analyzing the 3D model and color highlighting potentially problematic areas, such as, overhang, trapped volume, etc.
  • Automatic generation of support structures. This one is critical.
  • Automatic placement of multiple 3D models on the build plate.
  • Function to hollow 3D models and the automatic generation of lattice structure inside a hollowed model.
  • Resin Drain Hole drilling function, incase your 3D model contains any trapped volumes.
  • Mesh 3D model smoothing function.
  • Antialiasing.
Let's talk about computer system requirements too.
  • A computer that's capable of driving a secondary display at 1920 X 1080 pixels Full HD, with HDMI cable.
  • An USB port on the computer to connect with the Octave Light R1.
  • 64-bit Windows 7 SP1 or 64-bit Windows 8.
I myself have been using Mac as my primary computer for the past 13 years. So, I will push hard to have Mac OS X supported before October 2016.

3. What resin to use?

The majority of reasonably priced resins, that are engineered for DLP 3D Printers, works with the 405nm version of the Octave Light R1.

If your resin is sensitive to 405 nm, then the 405nm version of the Octave Light R1 is for you; if your resin is engineered for UV wavelength around 365 nm (for example, resins engineered for 355nm Solid State Lasers), then the 365 nm version of the R1 can get the job done.

The Octave Light R1 is compatible with most stereolithography resin in the market. You can print with your own medical, dental, or orthodontic certified resins.

The viscosity and other physical properties of the resin determine how thin the layers you can print. The resin that I used in the videos and photos of the Octave Light R1 is Maker Juice SF. It is a low viscosity resin, so I can print at 25 um per layer reliably. It is reasonably priced; it is tough; and it is popular among 3D Printer enthusiasts. The only problem with Maker Juice resin is that you have to stir the tank of resin in between prints, to keep the pigments in their resin from slowly settling to the bottom. Otherwise, everything is fine with the Maker Juice SF. There are of course other reasonably priced low viscosity resins out there that do not have this pigment settling problem.

The Octave Light R1 is compatible with transparent resins, semitransparent resins, and opaque (non-transparent) resins.

4. What's the actions plan of delivering the Octave Light R1 by May and June of 2016?

Please click here to download the pdf file of the actions plan. You can see that we ourselves have already invested all of the money into the Octave Light's engineering and manufacturing. We take the risk on our shoulders by spending our own money, time, and energy. We do this to make sure that you are not taking any risks. Place a purchase order on this pre-sales, and the Octave Light R1 is going to be delivered to you door, quickly.


5. Why use Indiegogo?

Indiegogo is utilized for its popularity and global reach. We are selling one of the best desktop 3D Printer in the world with an extremely affordable price, so we need a large quantity of orders to be economical.

6. Where is Octave Light Ltd.?

Our Hong Kong address is
Unit 1, 3/F., Block A, New Trade Plaza, 6 On Ping Street, Shatin, N.T., Hong Kong
Our Hong Kong location manages accounting and logistics.

Our mainland China address is
No.8 Qiaoxin Road, Qiaotou Dongguan, Guangdong, P.R. China
Postal Code: 523525
Our mainland China location is where our R&D, engineering, and manufacturing is done.

Your Octave Light R1 is going to be shipped out of our Hong Kong warehouse, to every location on this planet that FedEx can reach.

The Octave Light R1 is big in size, because we reject all compromises in our engineering. The shipping cost we charge is reasonable for a package of the size of the R1.

If you do not see your country in the shipping cost calculation of this Indiegogo pre-sales, please drop me an email ( charles@octavelight.com) and I will get it fixed.

7. Why name your company Octave Light?

People know about the octave musical scale of sound. Only a few people know that lightwave, which is also called electromagnetic wave, has the octave scale too. Our company is named after the natural phenomenon of the octave wave scale in light.

According to modern science, there are no differences between music and noise. Both are sound. However, music is actually different from noise or ordinary sound. What makes music eternal? What ordinary sound lacks?

I would like our products to have that musical eternal quality, which is a most subtle thing to be noticed.

8. When will you put up something on your OctaveLight.com website?

You are looking at a one man publicity team here. We have 11 full-time staffs, but all of them are focused on engineering and manufacturing the Octave Light R1. All of our resources are focused sharply onto engineering and manufacturing the R1.

I am going to put up something good onto our website once I have time available. I do not do something, unless I do it with quality and heart.
story_txt:
Update: We are looking for distributors and resellers, worldwide. Please contact me at 
charles@octavelight.com









Octave Light R1
the Highest Precision and the Most Dependable 3D Printer with an affordable price
Every 3D Printer enthusiast knows that top-down style
stereolithography is great. The Top-down with Recoater blade
method is what have been used in industrial-scale
stereolithography machines for more than 20 years. It is proven
and trusted. 

Yet, nobody knows how to manufacture an accurate top-down 3D
Printer with an affordable price. But things are OK now, because
the Octave Light R1 DLP Desktop 3D Printer is here to show people
how it is done. 

This is the pre-sales of the Octave Light R1, the highest
precision and the most dependable 3D Printer with an affordable
price. The objects printed by the Octave Light R1 are so accurate
that you can see the imprint of each individual DLP pixels when
inspecting the printed objects under a microscope. The 365 nm
versions of the R1 is also the first affordable 3D Printer in the
world with a 365 nm LED light source, which used to be only
available in industrial scale stereolithography machines. 

All orders will be delivered, even if our Indiegogo Flexible
Funding goal were not reached. I own the Octave Light company and I own its small factory, so I can personally promise you that your order will be
delivered, with high quality. The R1 will help you turn your
inspirations into reality. 

Since our first public announcement one month ago on 15th
February, 2016, we are already featured on two of the most
prominent 3D Printing online magazines: 







(Please click the two images above to open new windows to the articles. They are both good reads.) 

The pre-sales orders received from this Indiegogo campaign will be
shipped out of our factory starting 31st May, 2016. Why we can
deliver so fast? It is because we already have 11 full-time staffs
worked for 10 months on the Octave Light project; all major
manufacturing equipments are already installed; and the engineering
of the R1 is already in mass production stage. 

Hi, I am Charles Lo. It is my personal goal to engineer,
manufacture, and deliver the best 3D Printer to every family
on this planet. I am so committed to this mission I have already
invested my whole saving bank account into the Octave Light project.
You can help our mission by spreading the words, or by purchasing
one Octave Light R1 in this pre-sales campaign. 

By the way, the best way to contact me is emailing to

charles@octavelight.com



Why the Octave Light R1 is the highest precision and the most
dependable desktop 3D Printer with an affordable price? Please see
the reasons below. 


Laser Measured Precision

The Octave Light R1 features a Laser Measurement Sensor, that has a
resolution of 3 μm. 3 μm is less then the radius of a red blood
cell. The red dot you see on the resin in the photo above is the
laser. The rectangular and stylish box above the red dot is the
Sensor. 

This is the exact same Laser Measurement Sensor that is used in
silicon wafer manufacturing machines, in the semi-conductor industry
right now. When I say the R1 uses industrial grade components, I am
being serious. 

Why a Laser Measurement Sensor is essential for accuracy? It is
because when you put objects inside and under the resin surface, the
resin surface rises; and when you take objects out of the resin, the
resin surface lowers. 

All other affordable Top-down 3D Printers in the market today do not
know how to correctly solve their Z axis direction inaccuracy
problem, because of the rising and lowering of the resin surface. They
are out of control on how tall their printed objects actually are. 

The Octave Light R1 is the only affordable Top-down 3D Printer that
has Z axis precision! For each layer that we print, we are using the
Laser Measurement Sensor to determine the exact location of our
resin surface in real time, while we are vertically adjusting our
build platform. Therefore, the height of our printed objects are
always accurate, and all layers are always equally thin. 

All other affordable Top-down 3D Printers in the market today also
have the problem of having their projected image out of focus,
because of the varying location of the resin surface. So their
projected image is blurry. And their printed objects are deformed in
the X direction and Y direction. 

The Octave Light R1 is the only affordable Top-down 3D Printer that
can keep its projected image in shape focus. For each layer that we
print, after we have determined the exact location of our resin
surface with our Sensor, we move our Optical Engine vertically to
make sure that the focal plane always land on the resin surface.
When you inspect our printed objects, you will see our focus is so
accurate that each individual pixel of our Optical Engine is sharply
imprinted on the objects. 

Further, our Sensor is able to measure the top surface of
transparent resins. That's an astounding achievement, if you ask any
laser sensor engineer. So, the Octave Light R1 is compatible with
transparent and semi-transparent resins. 

Before we go to the next point, let's enjoy this photo of a
cathedral, two castable patterns of multi-stone rings, our logo, a
sphere, and various other interesting objects. They are all printed
simultaneously by the Octave Light R1 at 25 µm per layer. A normal
piece of letter paper is 100 µm thick. 25 µm is one quarter the
thickness of a piece of paper here. 

This 25 μm per layer performance of the Octave Light R1 is matching any industrial-scale Stereolithography machines. We are putting the precision and dependably of true industrial-level machines, right onto your desktop. Think of the implications of that! 

These printed objects are still attached to the build plate. We took the whole plate of objects
directly out of the R1, rinsed them with isopropyl alcohol, and put
them straight in front of a camera for you to see. No supporting rods
were added or removed. It was printed just this way. 


The next photo is the angel on top of the cathedral. All details are
printed perfectly. 



Ultraviolet LED runs cool

The light source of the Octave Light R1 is a powerful ultraviolet
LED, which has a long lifetime and is energy efficient. The Octave
Light R1 only turns on the ultraviolet LED right before each
exposure and immediately turns off the ultraviolet LED after each
exposure. The ultraviolet LED is off most of the time, when there is
no resin exposure to do. This further prolongs the already long
lifetime of the ultraviolet LED and the digital micro mirrors. The
Octave Light R1 is the first affordable 3D Printer to turn off its
ultraviolet LED during the time in between each exposures. 

The 365 nm LED version of the Octave Light R1 is the first
affordable 3D Printer to offer a 365 nm light source, which was
traditionally only used in industrial Stereolithography machines. 

Why our 365 nm light source is a groundbreaking feature for the whole affordable market? It is
because the majority of useful and advanced resin chemistries
only works with a true Ultraviolet light in the 365 nm range. With
our 365 nm LED, you are opened to a wide wide ranged of existing,
proven, and advanced stereolithography material selections! 

If you have any medical, dental, or orthodontic certified resins
that can only be printed with the 365 nm wavelength area (hint: 
DSM
Somos BioClear is ISO 10993-5, ISO 10993-10, and USP VI certified.), 
then the Octave Light R1 365nm is for you. The Octave Light R1 365nm 
is especially attractive to orthodontist who want to bring their 
previously out-sourced 3D Printing in-house, onto their own desktop. 

If you have any existing and traditional industrial grade
stereolithography resins (hint: all of those DSM Somos resins
engineered for 355nm Solid State Lasers), that have specific
mechanical properties or transparency properties you want, and those
existing resins are only sensitive to the 365 nm wavelength area,
then Octave Light R1 365nm can get the job done. 

Before we go to the next point, let's enjoy this Octave Light R1 print out at 1:1 scale of an orthodontic 3D scan. We are again printing at the finest setting of 25 µm layer thickness. The orthodontic model in the two photos below is still attached to the build plate. As always, we took it straight out of the R1, rinsed it with isopropyl alcohol, and put it directly in front of a camera for you to see. 

Doctors can use the Octave Light R1 to print out models of internal organs and structures from the 3D data of medical scanners. These 3D printed highly detailed and accurate physical models are particularly valuable for surgical planning. 

To push the boundary of technology further, doctors and dentists can digitally model surgical guides by referencing 3D scanned data, and then print out the surgical guides with medically certified resins. This will help the whole world perform surgeries in a even more precise and efficient way. Imagine, the day when every hospital in this world can easily effort their own high precision 3D Printer. Today is the day with the Octave Light R1. 

Orthodontists can use the Octave Light R1 to put their intraoral scanners to good use, by printing out orthodontic models directly on their own desktop, in their own office. 

Medial devices can be quickly tailor made, by trained medical professionals, with the Octave Light R1. The latest scientific discoveries and the newest technologies can be easily transformed into functional prototypes, with the Octave Light R1. 

This print out of a jaw of teeth excites not only orthodontist, dentist, and doctors. If you are a 3D artist, you can see how the Octave Light R1 correctly prints out the organic texture of the teeth and the gum. If you can digitally 3D sculpt the texture, we can print it out.




Custom Ultraviolet Optics with Direct Light Path

The Octave Light R1 is the only DLP 3D Printer in the affordable
market today, that offers both a UV LED light source and a more than
two millions pixels industrial-stereolithography-grade optical
engine. 

The majority of affordable DLP 3D Printers today (e.g., the
previous-market-leader B9 Creator) contain a consumer-grade
entertainment-level projector and use a projector light bulb as
their light source. Those projector light bulbs have short lifetime,
are energy inefficient, produce a lot of heat, and are needed to be
replaced frequently. Those cheap projectors they use were designed
and intended for movies playing and office presentation. Those
projectors were engineered to project a visual (non-ultraviolet)
colorful image a few meters away on a white wall. Those projectors
are simply inaccurate when being modified into a DLP 3D Printer,
resulting in their distorted images and their distorted prints. 

Some newer entries (for examples, Ember, MoonRay, M-Jewelry) into
the affordable DLP 3D Printers market tell you that they use an UV
LED Light Engine. What they did not tell you is that, their 405 nm
light engine contains a low end digital-micro-mirror array. Their
digital-micro-mirror array has only 912 X 1140 pixels. (That's about
1 million pixels) And those pixels are in diamond shape for cost
saving reasons. Diamond shaped pixels can cause inaccuracy and
blurry images. 

The optical engine of the Octave Light R1 is custom made from the
ground up for the purpose of industrial grade stereolithography. It
contains 1920 X 1080 (more than 2 millions) square pixels to
precisely control the light pattern on the surface of the liquid
resin. Its optical components are specifically engineered to
precisely transmit ultraviolet light. Each Octave Light R1 is
calibrated with 9 digital microscopes simultaneously, to ensure its
optical and mechanical precision, before shipping out of our
factory. 

The largest pixel count digital-micro-mirror array available on the
market with an affordable price today, is a 1920 X 1080 array. With
the Octave Light R1 you are already getting the highest number of
pixel counts, in the affordable market segment. The digital micro
mirror array in the R1 is so advanced that it is only available on
the market since the Q4 of 2015. We are at the edge of technology
here. 

All other affordable DLP 3D Printers that uses UV LED light source
destroyed the accuracy of their own optics by putting mirrors and
plastic windows in the optical path of the UV light. Their design is
compromising the accuracy of their optical engine, for packaging
reasons and for cost saving reasons. 

The Octave Light R1 rejects all compromises. There are no mirrors,
no glass or plastic windows, no vat (resin tray) bottom, nothing is
blocking the optical path of our optical engine. The precision lens
of the optical engine of the R1 throw its UV light directly onto the
top surface of resin. This is another reason why our optics are of
the highest precision in the whole desktop 3D Printer market. 

As always, we go one step further. The Optical Engine of the Octave
Light R1 has an internal light intensity sensor to detect the
brightness of the LED light source. This enables the accurate
adjustment of the Ultraviolet light intensity, to ensure that the
resin layers cure depth is consistent. 

Before we go to the next point, let's inspect two printed objects
with microscope. The photo directly below is the top of the 12 mm
diameter sphere in the cathedral print. Do you see the pixels on it?
Each pixel is an exact 50 µm X 50 µm square, which is just enough
area to tightly fit in four human macrophages. 


The Octave Light R1 is so accurate with our laser measured top-down
printing method and our industrial-stereolithography grade optics,
that you can use a microscope to look at our printed parts and see
the imprints of each of the 2 millions 50 μm X 50 μm pixels. 

The microscopic photo below is the gum between the lower two centre
front teeth of the orthodontic print. Again, you can see the square pixels.
Because our Optical Engine is sharply focused for each printed
layer, each pixel is sharply and precisely imprinted onto the
model. We do not blur things out; we are always sharply
focused. All details, even down to a pixel, are preserved with our
Top-down-with-Recoater-blade printing method. When we say the Octave
Light R1 is of the highest precision, we have the results to fully
back it up. This is not science fiction; this is the Octave Light
R1. 

 
Top-down Printing with Recoater Blade

The Top-down Printing with Recoater Blade method of the Octave Light R1, is how stereolithography is done on the industrial level, since more than 20 years ago. It is proven, reliable, and widely trusted. All other popular affordable DLP / SLA 3D Printers in the market today uses the bottom-up printing method. 

Ever wonder why a bottom-up 3D Printer fails to print frequently? Printing every layer in a bottom-up 3D printer is a Tug-of-war between their build plate and their resin tray bottom. And this Tug-of-war is not two teams pulling a rope, it is their bottom-up 3D printer pulling apart the objects it is trying to print. Will the printed object breaks away from the resin tray bottom and remains attached to build plate? Or will the printed object breaks in half and falls off from the build plate? If the printed object survives the printing of this layer, will it survives the printing of the next layer and the next? Each layer is a gamble with a bottom-up 3D printer. And one print job composes of thousands of layers. This is an exponential accumulation of the risk of failure. When they are taking thousands of gamble in each of their print job, it is easy for them to loss in their gambling. 

Occasionally, when a printed object survives the act of bottom-up 3D Printing, most of the fine details on that printed object may already be gone. 

The Bottom-up way of 3D Printing also requires a larger amount of thick support rods, to hopefully hold the printed object tightly onto their build plate. The many and thick support structures required by the Bottom-up method, means long manual clean up time and rough printed objects. It also means that the Bottom-up way of 3D Printing is wasting your valuable resins to print many and thick supporting rods. 

The Octave Light R1, with our Top-down with Recoater blade method, solidifies the currently printing layer of resin between air and the previously printed portion of the object, then proceed to Recoat the next layer of liquid resin on top of the just solidified layer. There are no peeling actions and no forceful actions with the Octave Light R1. It just works. 

Our Top-down with Recoater blade method does not require many support structures. With our method the supporting rods can be thin and the connecting points can be invisibly tiny. This means we save you manual clean up time on the the printed objects and we preserve the surface of your printed objects. This also means you can effectively utilize your valuable resins to print the objects you actually want to print. 

The Top-down printing with Recoater blade process is industrially proven to be the most reliable. That's why the Octave Light R1 is the most dependable 3D Printer with an affordable price. 

All other affordable Top-down 3D printers in the market today do not have a Recoater blade. So, their printer cannot keep each printed layer flat, unless they wait forever for each layer of resin to eventually flows flat by itself. With the thickness and flatness of their layers being uncontrollable, those without-Recoater-blade Top-down 3D printers are jokes. 

The Octave Light R1 has a Recoater blade to keep each layer precisely flat and keep the print time fast. This is how it is correctly done, and we are doing it with an affordable price. 

Before we go to the next point, let's be amazed by the two photos below, from the first print featured in our Indiegogo campaign video. (Our Indiegogo campaign video will be uploaded and posted soon.) You can see a superbly spherical 12 mm diameter sphere supported by only one long 1 mm diameter thin rod. Any experienced 3D printer user would think he/she is seeing a miracle here. 

Again, this is printed by the Octave Light R1 at 25 µm per layer. We took it straight out of the R1 along with the build plate attached, rinsed it with isopropyl alcohol, and put it directly in front of a microscope for you to see. This is exactly how it was printed, by the R1. 

I hereby challenge any bottom-up 3D printers to print this. This may be an impossible miracle for any other affordable 3D printers, but this is business as usual for the Octave Light R1. 




Adapts to Various Resin Levels

Unlike the majority of top down stereolithography machines that require you to fill the resin tank full to function, the Octave Light R1 can print normally with any amount of resin you have in the tank between the min mark and the max mark. The photo above on the left is the Octave Light R1 printing at the minimum resin level, and on the right is the R1 printing at the maximum resin level. The printhead of the Octave Light R1, is always hovering right above the resin surface during a print, no matter the resin surface is at a high or a low position. This is a feature we cannot find even in high-end industrial-scale Stereolithography machines. The Octave Light R1 is full of innovative and useful functions. 

The more resin you have in the tank, the taller the objects you can print; the less resin you have in the tank, the lower is your resin level, and the shorter in height the objects you can print. This means you can save on resins with the Octave Light R1, because you only need to keep the resin level just high enough to print the objects you want to print. 

Before we go to the next point, let's see the final design of the mass production version of the Octave Light R1. The taller design is the 405nm version of the R1. The shorter-in-height design is the 365nm version of the R1. We are only displaying four design drawings of the 405nm version on this page. To view the design of the 365nm version, and to view the rest of the drawings, please check our Indiegogo campaign image gallery. 

There is a Protective Light Shield around the Octave Light R1. So, don't worry. The Shield is made with the same ultraviolet light shielding transparent plastic as our orange color resin tank. There is a sensor to detect whether the Shield is opened or closed. And the Octave Light R1 will perform an emergency stop, if the Shield is accidentally opened. The design of the Shield is beyond being functional. The R1 still looks stylish and futuristic with the Shield installed, because the Protective Light Shield is always part of the design from the beginning. 

In between prints, you can leave the remaining resin in the tank of the Octave Light R1. You can store unused resin inside the R1, just like what you would do with any industrial-scale stereolithography machines. 

The resin tank is easily removable and replaceable. We sell spare resin tanks. So you can use an extra resin tank to conveniently and quickly switch between different kind of resins.







No Consumables, No troubles

Rejoice, for the Octave Light R1 has no consumable parts or coatings to be replaced! 
(And it is a joy to see the finished print emerging out of resin too.) 

Gone are the days of manually scraping and reapplying the silicone PDMS coating on the B9Creator and the Form 2. Gone are the days of replacing thin and stretchy PET films. Gone are the days of spending money, time, and energy on replacing consumables. 

All other bottom-up 3D Printers in the market today has consumable parts that needed to be replaced, frequently. The B9 Creator, the Form 2, and the Ember, etc, all have a week and soft silicone PDMS coating that needed to be reapplied after printing around 1 kg of resin. It is troublesome to manually remove the old silicone coating, manually level the resin tray, and then manually apply a new layer of silicone in a dust free environment. (Or does the Formlabs company expect you to buy a brand new resin tank every time the silicone coating gets sticky or cloudy? That's a big hidden cost for their Form 2 3D Printer.) If you are printing some long and vertical rods repeatedly in the same resin tray location, you will wear out the silicone coating on their bottom-up 3D Printer so fast that it won't last more than three prints. 

Other bottom-up 3D Printers that do not have a silicone coating have stretchy and thin Teflon based PET films that gets deformed, destroyed, or punctured by their printing action and needed to be replaced often. When those 3D Printer companies describe their flexing PET film as "permanent", I think they actually mean "a few months". 

The Octave Light R1 has no consumable parts to be replaced. We save your money and, most importantly, we save you valuable time. With the Octave Light R1, you can just print, print, and print, without interruption. 

Before we go to the next point, let's enjoy three photos of the beautiful prototype #4 of the Octave Light R1. The outer ultraviolet light shield and some appearance metal panels are not installed on the prototype #4. The four integrated handles, some round corners, and a few details were not machined into the prototype #4. Otherwise, the prototype #4 is nearly mass production ready. It was already manufactured with our mass production equipments. It was made with the same kind of large scale CNC milling machines that's used for manufacturing the Macbook Pro. By the way, the Octave Light company have purchased the CNC mill in November 2015 for the sole purpose of manufacturing Octave Light 3D Printers. 

At this moment when I am writing this, we are assembling the prototype #5 and the prototype #6 simultaneously, to help us adjust our own manufacturing processes. We are already one foot stepped into mass production. 

The 365 nm Optical Engine of the prototype #7 is already completely built and fully tested. We are also machining the mechanical parts of the prototype #7 at this moment. 

I promise you the mass production version of the R1 is at least three times more stunning then the already aesthetically pleasing prototype #4. Put the Octave Light R1 in an art gallery and it fits just right in. 





Industrial-grade and Easy to Use

Besides the advanced technologies already mentioned above, the Octave Light R1 contains these industrial-grade components: 

Two 16 mm specification thick ball-bearing screws to precisely and smoothly drive the Printhead Z axis and the Build platform W axis; 
Three Nema 23 big stepper motors, to efficiently produce high torque with low electric current; and 
Three pairs of matched, preloaded, and P5 rated, Angular Contact Bearings, to accurately support the Recoater C axis, the Printhead Z axis, and the Build platform W axis. 

We use 6061 T651 aluminum and stainless steels to CNC machine the chassis of the Octave Light R1. Even the T651 heat treatment on our aluminum is aircraft grade. 

Most importantly, all of these technical achievements and industrial-grade components are integrated perfectly into the easy to use Octave Light R1. All you need to do is load your 3D Model into a computer and press the print button. We are here to put the the full power of industrial grade Stereolithography right into you hand today, in a stylish and simple-to-use desktop machine. 

Right before we go to the final point, let me introduce you to some of our core team members. In the photo below, from left to right, is 

Gu, our Electrical Engineer; 
me; 
Lisa, our Purchaser; 
Zhao, our Mechanical Engineer; and 
Bo, our Manufacturing Manager. 

Our Software Engineer, Sujan, and our five machinists are too busy to make it into this photo. 



Specification, Pricing, and Delivery
Please click here to download the pdf file regarding the specification, pricing, and delivery time of the four versions of the Octave Light R1. 




Why do we sell our ultra advanced and futuristic 3D Printer so cheap? Obviously, a company does not survive without profit. But the Octave Light company is not motivated by profit; we are motivated by our mission of making this world a better place for everyone. We are here to bring highly advanced technology to every family on this planet at the lowest price we can manage. And we need your help to accomplish that. 

Please share our news on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media. If you are a journalist or a blogger, please write about us. Please talk about the Octave Light R1 with your friends and family members. 

The short link to our Indiegogo campaign is https://igg.me/at/R1

We regularly upload new videos onto our Vimeo channel. Please check on our Vimeo channel often and share our videos often. 
https://vimeo.com/OctaveLight


You can help by spreading the words on the Octave Light R1, or you can help by purchasing one of the four versions of the R1 from this Indiegogo Pre-sales. Either way, we are thankful. 

All of the researches, components selections, and engineerings are already done and finished with the Octave Light R1. We are already at the stage of manufacturing. I myself have 7 years of experiences being the Manufacturing Manager and Operation Manager of two world-class factories for two different USA companies. That means I know how to correctly do mass production. You are well taken care of. 

This is the pre-sales of the Octave Light R1. We need a large volume of orders to be economical with our low price. We are using Indiegogo Flexible Funding. Whether our funding goal is reached or not, all orders is going to be quickly shipped. Everyone who have the excellent taste of purchasing an Octave Light R1 through our Indiegogo campaign, is going to have their R1 delivered to their door, in high quality. 

The discounted pre-sales price last only until 23rd April, 2016. After this pre-sales, if you buy the R1 on our website, the price will be the normal retail price. We are giving out this big discount because this is a pre-sales. So, please take advantage of this opportunity here. 


If you are jewelry designer, the Octave Light R1 405nm Fine is for you. You can print out castable pattens of your beautiful jewelries right on your own desktop. Any reasonably priced castable resins designed for DLP 3D Printer is going to work. With the R1, your jewelries are going to have the finest and most beautiful details, which other bottom-up 3D Printers cannot achieve. 

The Fine versions of the R1 are perfect for investment casting of precious metals. Besides making jewelries, you can also make precision medical or dental devices with this method. 

If you are a 3D artist, then the Octave Light R1 405nm Big is for you. With the R1's comfortably big build volume, you can do limited productions of 1:6 scale figures right in your home. And if your imaginations are running wild, then larger scale figures like 1:4 can be accomplished with certain tricks. The R1 can correctly represent any textures you can digitally sculpt. The R1 preserves the surface of your model and saves your time doing post-processing, because the contact place between the support rods and the printed objects are tiny dots. It is time to turn your digital arts into real physical collectables. 

Engineers and Industrial Designers can use the Octave Light R1 to print their CAD drawings into accurate and functional prototypes. If you need to use existing industrial grade stereolithography resins to simulate the physical properties of certain types of plastics (e.g. PE, PP, ABS) or to print highly visually transparent models, then the 365nm versions is for you. If you want the cost saving of using cheap DLP 3D Printer resins, while still having the power of a true industrial-level Stereolithography machine, then the 405nm versions are for you. The Fine versions of the R1 with their 50 um X 50 um pixel pitch is perfect for printing smooth running small gears and mechanisms. If you don't print small and fast-spining gears often, then the Big version is for you. 
You can even do digital manufacturing with the Octave Light R1 right in your home. 

If you are an orthodontist, then it is time to bring your previously out-sourced 3D Printing in-house, with the Big versions of the Octave Light R1. Please determine which resins you are going to use first, before selecting between the 365nm versions or the 405nm versions. The ISO 10993-5, ISO 10993-10, and USP VI certified DSM Somos BioClear is compatible with the 365nm versions of the R1. Dreve Dentamid is selling dental/orthodontic resins that are engineered to be printed with 405 nm LED DLP system. But I know that Dreve also have stereolithography resins that can be printed with the 365nm versions of the R1. 

The resin from a famously expensive German 3D Printer company, which I will not name here, are actually compatible with the 405nm versions of the R1. The price of the R1 is at least 1/5 the price of a 3D Printer from that German 3D Printer company. 

If you are a doctor, a dentist, an orthodontist, or other medical professionals, the Octave Light R1 is here to help you provide medical services quicker and at a lower cost. Obviously, I am an industrialist; I am not a doctor, not a dentist, not an orthodontist, and not any other medical professionals. So, please do your own researches and make your decision yourself. You are welcome to contact me by emailing to 
charles@octavelight.com to discuss more on the potential usages of the Octave Light R1. 

No matter who you are, the Octave Light R1 helps you easily turn your inspirations into reality. 



Before we go to the Q&A section, please click here to download the pdf file of the bonus gifts, when the pre-sales orders exceeds certain volumes. 
These are attractive gifts. So, here are even more reasons to share the news on the Octave Light R1. 




And here is the first video we every publicly posted, on 15th Feb, 2016. It is a bit long, and our video shooting skills certainly improved a lot within one month. 



Questions and Answers Section: 
1. How does the Octave Light R1 3D printer compare to others? 
Please click here to download the pdf file of comparison. I promise an entertaining read. 




2. How about software? 
The computer software that is distributed with the Octave Light R1, is called Octave Light App. It is written from the ground up by my software engineer. Our software is right now in alpha stage. It will be ready in two months, when we are shipping out the Octave Light R1. 

Here is a bit of history on how our computer software came to be. The full source code of a computer software called UVDLPSlicerController, was licensed to me by the original author of UVDLPSlicerController, in May 2015. In June of 2015, I emailed the author saying that I would like to pay him to distribute his software. But the author replied saying that they "are currently not accepting any new clients". So, I made the decision of totally abandoning that UVDLPSlicerController computer software. And started hiring my own full-time software engineer in July 2015 to write our own computer software called the Octave Light App, from scratch. We have worked on our own independent piece of computer software for 8 months now. 

The Octave Light App is easy to use and powerful. It is going to be a free download from our website, when the R1 is shipping. So you can download the latest software upgrade from our website regularly. And every month you will get new features and improvements to the software, for free. 

The firmware of the R1 is packaged inside the Octave Light App too. So, when you are upgrading the Octave Light App, you can conveniently upgrade the firmware inside the R1 over the USB cable, by clicking a few buttons. The firmware inside the prototypes is written by me. The firmware inside the final mass production version of the R1 is written by my electrical engineer and me, using industrially proven components, including the FreeRTOS. (By the way, we design and layout the printed circuit boards of the R1, in-house.) 

Here are some of the planned features of the Octave Light App: 

Functions to help you conveniently determine the optimum ultraviolet light intensity and exposure time, for any resin you put into the Octave Light R1. 
Functions to guide you through the initial setup and preparation of the Octave Light R1. 
Basic features like resizing, rotating, duplicating, and positioning 3D models within the build volume. 
Basic features like importing mesh based 3D file formats, e.g. STL and OBJ. 
Direct importing of parametric solid modeling file formats, e.g. STEP and IGES. Engineers and Industrial Designers would love this feature. Solid modeling do not have the inaccuracy of the mesh based formats. 
Auto analyzing the 3D model and color highlighting potentially problematic areas, such as, overhang, trapped volume, etc. 
Automatic generation of support structures. This one is critical. 
Automatic placement of multiple 3D models on the build plate. 
Function to hollow 3D models and the automatic generation of lattice structure inside a hollowed model. 
Resin Drain Hole drilling function, incase your 3D model contains any trapped volumes. 
Mesh 3D model smoothing function. 
Antialiasing. 

Let's talk about computer system requirements too. 

A computer that's capable of driving a secondary display at 1920 X 1080 pixels Full HD, with HDMI cable. 
An USB port on the computer to connect with the Octave Light R1. 
64-bit Windows 7 SP1 or 64-bit Windows 8. 

I myself have been using Mac as my primary computer for the past 13 years. So, I will push hard to have Mac OS X supported before October 2016. 

3. What resin to use? 
The majority of reasonably priced resins, that are engineered for DLP 3D Printers, works with the 405nm version of the Octave Light R1. 

If your resin is sensitive to 405 nm, then the 405nm version of the Octave Light R1 is for you; if your resin is engineered for UV wavelength around 365 nm (for example, resins engineered for 355nm Solid State Lasers), then the 365 nm version of the R1 can get the job done. 

The Octave Light R1 is compatible with most stereolithography resin in the market. You can print with your own medical, dental, or orthodontic certified resins. 

The viscosity and other physical properties of the resin determine how thin the layers you can print. The resin that I used in the videos and photos of the Octave Light R1 is Maker Juice SF. It is a low viscosity resin, so I can print at 25 um per layer reliably. It is reasonably priced; it is tough; and it is popular among 3D Printer enthusiasts. The only problem with Maker Juice resin is that you have to stir the tank of resin in between prints, to keep the pigments in their resin from slowly settling to the bottom. Otherwise, everything is fine with the Maker Juice SF. There are of course other reasonably priced low viscosity resins out there that do not have this pigment settling problem. 

The Octave Light R1 is compatible with transparent resins, semitransparent resins, and opaque (non-transparent) resins. 

4. What's the actions plan of delivering the Octave Light R1 by May and June of 2016? 
Please click here to download the pdf file of the actions plan. You can see that we ourselves have already invested all of the money into the Octave Light's engineering and manufacturing. We take the risk on our shoulders by spending our own money, time, and energy. We do this to make sure that you are not taking any risks. Place a purchase order on this pre-sales, and the Octave Light R1 is going to be delivered to you door, quickly. 




5. Why use Indiegogo? 
Indiegogo is utilized for its popularity and global reach. We are selling one of the best desktop 3D Printer in the world with an extremely affordable price, so we need a large quantity of orders to be economical. 

6. Where is Octave Light Ltd.? 
Our Hong Kong address is 
Unit 1, 3/F., Block A, New Trade Plaza, 6 On Ping Street, Shatin, N.T., Hong Kong
Our Hong Kong location manages accounting and logistics. 

Our mainland China address is 
No.8 Qiaoxin Road, Qiaotou Dongguan, Guangdong, P.R. China
Postal Code: 523525
Our mainland China location is where our R&D, engineering, and manufacturing is done. 

Your Octave Light R1 is going to be shipped out of our Hong Kong warehouse, to every location on this planet that FedEx can reach. 

The Octave Light R1 is big in size, because we reject all compromises in our engineering. The shipping cost we charge is reasonable for a package of the size of the R1. 

If you do not see your country in the shipping cost calculation of this Indiegogo pre-sales, please drop me an email (
charles@octavelight.com) and I will get it fixed. 

7. Why name your company Octave Light? 
People know about the octave musical scale of sound. Only a few people know that lightwave, which is also called electromagnetic wave, has the octave scale too. Our company is named after the natural phenomenon of the octave wave scale in light. 

According to modern science, there are no differences between music and noise. Both are sound. However, music is actually different from noise or ordinary sound. What makes music eternal? What ordinary sound lacks? 

I would like our products to have that musical eternal quality, which is a most subtle thing to be noticed. 

8. When will you put up something on your OctaveLight.com website? 
You are looking at a one man publicity team here. We have 11 full-time staffs, but all of them are focused on engineering and manufacturing the Octave Light R1. All of our resources are focused sharply onto engineering and manufacturing the R1. 

I am going to put up something good onto our website once I have time available. I do not do something, unless I do it with quality and heart.

story:
NOTE:  

For any questions regarding shipping or tracking a order please email Ron.Shapiro@zinovta.com and for any questions regarding the product Randall.Cornfield@zinovta.com  thanks.

It's simplicity at its best. A knife that rolls easily through your food, giving you precision cutting and incredible power, all in one motion. Perfect dicing, slicing, chopping and mincing each and every time! From cutting carrots - to slicing herbs - to mincing garlic, bolo will quickly become your new favorite companion in the kitchen!

WHY A ROLLING KNIFE?

Great knives do two things very well: feel good in your hand and cut extremely well. bolo takes this one step further, by making a knife that sits naturally in your hand, and channels the power from your hand and wrist to the blade to make cutting easier than ever before!!



HOW IT WORKS

Traditional knives all have one common deficiency; the force you apply on the handle diminishes as it goes from the handle, through to the blade, and then to the cutting surface.

bolo changes that. By placing the force of the hand directly ABOVE the blade, you have full control for precision cutting, while relieving your hand and wrist from unnatural movements.  

bolo cuts your food on the FIRST roll of the blade, each and every time!

Holding down on bolo's brake transforms it into a chopper! Great for chopping the tops off of carrots, lettuce, celery and more!

As easy as bolo is for cutting, bolo plus is even easier for tenderizing! 

Making meat prep a breeze!

GIVING BOLO AS A GIFT

We won’t have inventory until March 2016 but you can still give a bolo for Christmas! Once we reach our goal, email us at xmas@meetbolo.com and we’ll send you a beautiful gift certificate that you can print out and give to a lucky someone on your Christmas list. We’ll ship your bolo to you as soon as it arrives.

The Pastry Blade brings fun and ease to your baking! Gliding through your dough, bolo makes it as easy as pie! 

HOW WE GOT HERE

Years of engineering and design work went in to creating the perfect balance of design and performance.


WHO WE ARE 

Inventing great houseware products is our thing!

For more than 20 years, we have designed and manufactured private label programs for major retailers, direct to consumer companies and TV home shopping companies.

Today, we're stepping out from behind the curtain to sell direct to our consumers, and introduce our latest invention - bolo.

Chef Randall Cornfield and his team include a host of talented designers, engineers and business executives who have made the successful journey from design to product - time and time again.

WHERE WE ARE 

With our team’s expertise in design, engineering, tooling and manufacturing, we have completed the knife design, prototype, and various levels of testing and refinement. Tooling is complete and with our patent in place, we are ready to go!

WHAT WE NEED

We are now looking to pre sell bolo until our first production is produced. 

ABOUT SHIPPING RATES

US backers we are shipping via USPS - First Class Mail Parcel delivery will deliver your bolo (s) in 3-4 business days.

Canadian backers - we are shipping via Canada Post  – Regular Parcel will deliver your bolo(s) in 2-3 business days. 

For Rest of World backers, please choose from the countries listed in the Rewards. The rates listed are very economical, however delivery can take 4-6 weeks. 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

Time is usually the biggest risk in working with international manufacturing firms. Our project is no different.

We have our supply chain partners ready and able to help us manufacture bolo, but unforeseen bumps can happen along the way. The timeline we provided above is our most realistic estimate at the current moment.

FAQ's

Is bolo dishwasher safe?

The bolo handle is dishwasher safe. It is best to hand rinse and pat dry the blade.

How to sharpen the blade

bolo will stay sharp longer than a regular knife because: 1) the blade is always rolling and not cutting on the same location all the time, 2) you need much less force to cut food so there is much less wear on the edge and 3) it is made of a high grade steel that has a hardness factor of Rc-59 on the Rockwell test, keeping the blade sharp longer.

You can take bolo to any professional knife sharpener, send to us or do it yourself. We will gladly sharpen your bolo for free. Please send just the blade to us (carefully and securely packaged) along with return postage and return packaging. If you want to sharpen it yourself, use caution, hold the blade with a glove and slowly place the blade in an electric sharpener, rotating slowly.

Is it safe for children?

This is a knife so this is something every parent will have to decide for themselves. I (Chef Randall) as a parent allow my 3 kids to use it. My son is 12 years old and can use it extremely well, and we always supervise our daughters (age 8-10). I don’t let them cut hard vegetables, but as many parent knows kids like to participate in cooking so as an example my 8 year old helped me cut up parsley. I took off the leaves for her and then I showed her how to do it without having her hand on the cutting board so there was no way she could cut herself – I would not of course let her cut a carrot, which needs to be held when cutting.

What is best place to use bolo?

bolo was designed to be used on flat surfaces, such as a cutting board, where you would use a traditional knife.

Can it cut meat like it does vegetables?

Yes bolo can. Slice or cube steak, chicken or pork for fajitas and salads. It's a really great slicer of all cooked meats.

Will food accumulate inside bolo`s handle?

We’ve designed in to the handle ‘Food Guards’ to restrict food from going inside. While some food will accumulate inside the handle, a simply rinse is usually all that is required.

How was bolo designed to be safe ?

The bolo handle was designed with safety in mind at three (3) critical points:

1. Two (2) inside tabs secure the bottom,
2. The folding handle cover, that locks the halves together on top, and
3. An elongated pin that connects the halves at the front.

How to clean the blade?

The blade is not hard to clean; you hold it between your fingers with a pinch and just rinse it. When the blade has stuff stuck on it like cheese etc. use a sponge – we are going to post videos on cleaning on our web site as soon as the campaign is over – we are planning a lot of great demo videos so if there is anything anyone wants to see just message us and we will include them.

story:
Introducing the Orchid LED Table Lamp by Purillume

Light is powerful.  It can wake you up and energize you.  It can keep you alert and productive.  It can help you relax and the right light can even help you sleep.  The Purillume LED Table lamps bring out the best light to make you look and feel good no matter your mood, preference or activity.  Finally, a light that shines above the rest.

 

What people are saying

The Orchid LED Lamp by Purillume can change to fit your mood and activity. 

With the Orchid lamp, you can change color temperature and take charge of your lighting. 

Start your day with waking to light like a gentle sunrise, nurture productivity with bright, white light and power down with a warm glow to prepare for a good night’s sleep—all from one lamp. 

The Orchid table lamp easily transforms generic, impersonal lighting into a completely customized lighting experience to help you experience life in a new light.

Wake setting:  The lamp helps you gently start your day by simulating a sunrise.  The light starts from a warm glow of a sunrise and "rises" to a bright daylight white, just like the sun  (clouds not included!).

Work setting:  This bright white daylight setting helps keep you awake and alert.  It can help you stay energized so you can power through the post-lunch food coma or late-night work session.

Relax setting: Wind down your day with warm, soft light that dims like an incandescent.

Sleep setting: Dim the Orchid to simulate a sunset as fast or slowly as you'd like to help you drift off. Night light mode (less than 3 lumens) provides a warm (non-blue) ambient light to promote a restful night sleep. 

Master vs. Satellite - What's the difference?

 

Perks

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are asking for your support.  If you can’t make a monetary donation, please try to help us in other ways.  Share this with your family, friends, and colleagues.  Talk about us on social media.  Use the Indiegogo share tool.  Help to spread the word!

Manufacturing / Fulfillment timeline

We are looking to raise $20,000.  I have taken this project from idea to prototype and now I need your help to bring it into production.  These funds will be used to push our lamps into production as well as finalizing the mobile app for iOS and Android. 

Our manufacturing partner is all set up and our plan is to ship the lamps by the end of August.

Production Design Update

From our prototypes in the photos and video, we have made a few modifications to the design.  The base size is 21% smaller so it takes up less desk/night stand space.  We have made the lamp 2" taller.  The USB chargers were moved to the side of the lamp and we are offering the lamp in two' different finishes (Espresso - on the left & Cherry - on the right). Here is an early photo of the lamp finishes:

Finally, we are making the lamp shade an optional add-on.  While you are welcome to purchase it from us, we have paired the lamp with existing lamp shades that you can find online and as an alternative, we have provided you with the dimensions if you want to pick your own. For the best lighting results, we recommend a white linen shade to minimize any color variations from the lamp shade.  Here is a great link for information on how to pick your own shade.

A square or rectangular shade will best match the lamp body, however, we have found round empire or drum lampshades to work as well, depending on your preference.  Retail Lampshade links:

Purillume Lamp Shade:

Rectangle:        

Empire: 

Restoration Hardware -

Rectangular White Silk Shade (Size D)

Rectangular White Linen Shade (Size D)

Square White Linen Shade

Lamps Plus

Square Lamp Shade

Bed Bath & Beyond:

Empire Style 17" Hardback Linen Lamp Shade

13" Hardback Linen Square Lamp Shade

Lowe's

White Linen Fabric Square Lamp Shade

Home Depot:

White Round Hardback Fabric Shade

Come see the Purillume Orchid LED Lamp in Action:

  • May 23-25 - Display week at Los Angeles Convention Center-
    • Lincoln Technology booth #1546
  • May 24 - Durham, NC:  10:30am-1:30pm @ American Underground
  • May 31 -  Newport Beach, CA:  5pm-8pm, Radisson Hotel Newport Beach (email if interested to see them in person)
  • Junw 15:  Triangle TechBreakfast:  8am at RTP Headquarters
    • Register at MeetUp:  http://meetu.ps/c/1zWyv/z91vn/f 

Please message us for more details or if you would like an update on other viewings.  

Here's a quick look at all the features of the master lamp:

The Orchid Team: 

Articles on how light affects health/sleep:

  • Blue light has a dark side - Harvard Health Publications

  • What’s in a Color? The Unique Human Health Effects of Blue Light

on the left & Cherry - on the right). Here is an early photo of the lamp finishes:Finally, we are making the lamp shade an optional add-on.  While you are welcome to purchase it from us, we have paired the lamp with existing lamp shades that you can find online and as an alternative, we have provided you with the dimensions if you want to pick your own. For the best lighting results, we recommend a white linen shade to minimize any color variations from the lamp shade.  Here is a great link for information on how to pick your own shade.A square or rectangular shade will best match the lamp body, however, we have found round empire or drum lampshades to work as well, depending on your preference.  Retail Lampshade links:Purillume Lamp Shade:Rectangle:        Empire: Restoration Hardware -Rectangular White Silk Shade (Size D)Rectangular White Linen Shade (Size D)Square White Linen ShadeLamps PlusSquare Lamp ShadeBed Bath & Beyond:Empire Style 17" Hardback Linen Lamp Shade13" Hardback Linen Square Lamp ShadeLowe'sWhite Linen Fabric Square Lamp ShadeHome Depot:White Round Hardback Fabric ShadeCome see the Purillume Orchid LED Lamp in Action:
May 23-25 - Display week at Los Angeles Convention Center-Lincoln Technology booth #1546

May 24 - Durham, NC:  10:30am-1:30pm @ American Underground

May 31 -  Newport Beach, CA:  5pm-8pm, Radisson Hotel Newport Beach (email if interested to see them in person)
Junw 15:  Triangle TechBreakfast:  8am at RTP HeadquartersRegister at MeetUp:  http://meetu.ps/c/1zWyv/z91vn/f 

Please message us for more details or if you would like an update on other viewings.  Here's a quick look at all the features of the master lamp:The Orchid Team: Articles on how light affects health/sleep:
Blue light has a dark side - Harvard Health Publications
What’s in a Color? The Unique Human Health Effects of Blue Light

story:
The BedShelfie is a rethink of the age-old nightstand inspired by Small Space Living & Minimalism. Here's the BedShelfie in a nutshell:

(1) Made for the Millennial Minimalist. The BedShelfie clears up floor space while still giving you the ease of a nightstand. It’s also more fun to transport :)

(2) Smart Design. The BedShelfie attaches to nearly any bed frame, without tools, using a clamping system that comfortably holds up to 15 pounds of your most important bedside items within arm’s reach.

(3) Eco-Friendly. The BedShelfie is handcrafted out of bamboo which grows exponentially faster than wood.

 

 

 

 

  

 

 

  The BedShelfie is perfect for:

  • Minimalists freeing themselves of clunky furniture ( ... looking at you Tiny House Peeps)
  • Urbanites mastering the fine art of Small Space City Living 
  • College Students squeezed into sardine-like dorm rooms
  • Parents who want to give their kids the best bunk bed experience ever

 

 

 

 

 

  The BedShelfie features:

  • A clean and minimal design profile for versatility 
  • A wire slot for easy device charging 
  • Rounded edges for safety 
  • A versatile clamp design that accommodates bedframe edges up to 2.25 inches wide 
  • A sturdy hold - it can hold up to 15 pounds
  • Thick felt padding on clamp touch points to prevent scratching
  • 2 Colors: Natural Bamboo + Black Oil Stained Bamboo
     
  • Surface Area: ~12.75 x 8.5 inches (think 13 inch Macbook) 
  • Weight: ~3.5lbs

 

  

 

 

Rewind two years.

Rent was skyrocketing in LA causing apartment square footage to shrink
+
I was beginning to realize “less is more” (after reading 'The Life Changing Magic of Tidying Up')

=

I sought to free myself from bedroom clutter. Some combination of traveling for work (as a Disney Imagineer) + moving apartments every few years allowed me to finally give up on clunky furniture. 

From working in the complex world of Theme Parks, I knew the best design always fulfilled multiple goals. To replace the nightstand, the solution had to be equal parts beautiful, sturdy, easy to use and eco-friendly.

  

  

My first ‘aha’ moment came when studying the incredible strength and versatility of the time-tested clamp mechanism.

The design question, at hand, became finding a way to translate the strength of something that was traditionally metal, into something both beautiful and eco-friendly.

 

 

 

 

  

 

Building a sustainable future is absolutely paramount to us. We're proud to handcraft the BedShelfie out of Bamboo. Even though Bamboo is technically considered a grass, it's harder than Oak and matures in just 3-5 years (vs 100 years for Oak). So it's an incredible renewable resource.

 

 

 

 
 
 

 

  

After months of prototyping, samples and real world testing (several of which are on my own bed right now), we're proud to partner with a production facility that shares the same values of craftsmanship, ethics and environmental standards. 

As you can see in the images below, we're nearing the completion on our first 500 BedShelfies for the first 500 backers. 

We're excited to announce the BedShelfie is ready for the world!

story:
Behindertengerechtes Fahrrad für Nick #HelftNick. 
Ermöglichen Sie Nick zu seinem Geburtstag mehr Teilhabe am Leben

Gerne würde Nick wie jeder andere Junge in seinem Alter mit dem Fahrrad zur Eisdiele, zum Kiosk, zu seinen Freunden fahren oder an gemeinsamen Radtouren mit der Familie teilnehmen. Doch das kann er nicht. Denn Nick ist seit seinem 4. Lebensmonat komplex schwerst mehrfach behindert und in der Pflegestufe 3+. Die Anschaffung eines speziellen Fahrrads, welches vorn eine Laderampe und spezielle Fixiersysteme für ihn und seinen Rollstuhl hat, kostet viel Geld:

Link zum Fahrrad, hier klicken...

Grundmodell   5.020,00 EUR + Motor 2.670,00 EUR + Zubehör  


Daher sind wir auf Ihre Unterstützung angewiesen. Es wäre großartig, Nick zu seinem 14. Geburtstag am 15. Juli 2015 einen Gutschein oder sogar direkt ein Fahrrad überreichen zu können.

Erfahren Sie gerne mehr über Nick unter den folgenden Links:
http://www.helftnick.de

http://www.change.org/helftnick

story:
Huglee includes all the experience of the weighted blanket industry for the past few years, as well comments and feedback from millions of customers and expertise of leading sleep disorder clinics. 

The Huglee blanket will help you feel protected and sleep deeply like a baby. The therapeutic heavy blanket distributes deep pressure ideally across your body. Huglee imitates the sense of hugging. This increases the level of serotonin and melatonin while decreasing cortisol - which improves your mood and provides healthy sleep at the same time.

A regular heavy blanket will move deep into the cover, so unlike our solution, it needs to be pinned. So to wash the heavy blanket you'll need to untie 12 laces and then tie it back after the wash. We feel this procedure is quite tiresome, so we used Velcro fasteners for quick attachment of your blanket to its cover, making the process fast, simple and convenient.

To avoid having to whip the blanket, we've used a very sturdy zipper on our cover, which opens by 270 degrees angle. This allows you to unzip the blanket in three directions and makes the procedure easier.

To make sure you're kept warm even in most chilling days, we've made one side of the blanket out of the warming dotted minky material (which at the same time, thanks to its pimpled texture and unlike the other types of minky, leaves some space when you're covered, which ensures your skin can breathe).

Our bamboo is the type used for premium bedding sets. Unlike our competitors, we've increased the density from 200 to 300T, which allows the bamboo to stay amazingly soft, yet improve its durability.

Other heavy blankets end up teared and scatter their filler everywhere. That is why we've used a reinforced side stitching to protect the filler from spilling.

Other blankets' filler eventually leaks into neighbouring pockets, and as a result, all the weight ends up centered in one spot and the whole point of the blanket is lost. We've implemented double stitching which prevents filler spillage and reduced pocket dimensions from standard 6x6 to 4x4 for an even better weight distribution.

With heavy blankets, the material undergoes higher strain and breaks down relatively soon. We're using only 100% cotton and increased its density to 300T, reaching the perfect balance of material and hardness. 

We're using special glass beads for the blanket's weight, this lets you avoid having to deal with foul odour, which inevitably turns up when using plastic or silicone filler. 

We've also reduced the size of the filler beads to 0.7 mm. This allows you to enjoy maximum comfort during use without feeling them. They also produce no noise when moving under the blanket.

Our team decided to work with the biggest factory we have found. It is far from the cheapest, but we know for sure that they will manufacture the best quality product and provide excellent service.

story:
*******************************************Update***********************************************

I am astonished how quickly we reached our goal! Thank you so much to everyone who contributed!! But don't stop now, we still have many days of fundraising left to go.  The original $550 will go directly to buying ten mattresses for the children currently going without, but that doesn't mean more funds couldn't be utilized. Any extra money raised will go towards purchasing  new bed frames which will be placed in the new residential building, when construction is over. We had already started planning a Haitian art auction to raise the additional $4500 needed  to replace the mattresses for all the children and buy new bed frames, but if some of that could be raised on this site that would be great! Once again, thank you everyone for your donations, your support means everything to the orphanage, as well as, to myself. 

************************************************************************************************

Short Summary

In early 2011 I was given the opportunity to work with the Rutgers School of Social Work to raise money for the charity of my choice. In my research I came across LaConcorde Orphanage. Located in Carrefour, Haiti, the institution was severely affected by the 2010 earthquake. The facilities were completely destroyed, leaving 50 orphans with just a few tents to live under in a lot of only 700 sq feet. Along with Architecture for Humanity and through Love Takes Root, I have been raising money for the construction of a new school for the Orphanage. While this campaign has been extremely successful, there are still several basic needs for the children that are not being met. On a recent visit, I discovered that 10 of the children were sleeping on wire bed frames with no mattresses. This is absolutely unacceptable, as all children at least deserve a bed to sleep on. I have launched this campaign in order to alleviate the situation as quickly as possible, hoping to raise enough funds so that the director of the orphanage may purchase mattresses for the children. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised from this campaign will be sent to the director of the orphanage, Frantz Bastien. Frantz will then use the funds to purchase mattresses for the 10 children sleeping without them. We would prefer to purchase the mattresses in Haiti, as Frantz will have better discretion in deciding which mattresses will fit the bed frames, in addition to the expense and time commitment involved in sending materials to Haiti. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use the funds collected to buy as many mattresses as possible and some of the children will remain on the wire frames until funds can be secured.

The Impact

It is important that we do not overlook the simple necessities when dealing with disaster zones. For these children to grow into successful adults, it is important that they have their basic needs met while they are young. By having mattresses to sleep on, the children will be more able to focus in school and become educated and strong young adults; which is exactly what Haiti needs for a sustainable future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot help financially, spreading the word always helps and would be much appreciated! Feel free to click on the indiegogo share tools and tell your friends all about it. Also leave comments and message us - our efforts in Haiti go beyond just this campaign, so you might be able to help out in another aspect.

Other Ways We Have Helped

In the past, infectious disease transferring from child to child was a big issue in the small lot that the orphanage is currently located. In order to prevent this from occurring, Love Takes Root held a fundraiser and collected enough funds to provide each child with their own personalized blanket, reducing the amount of germs that are spread. Since that initiative began, the occurrence of ring worm and other disease in the children has been cut in half.

story:
Head over to Touchjet.com today to get your Touchjet Pond! >


Touchjet Pond (Formerly TouchPico) is a tiny handheld projector that turns any surface into a giant touchscreen. It is an interactive Android PC with projected touch interface and wireless streaming that allows you to:




TouchPico is unique because it provides users with many versatile options. It's for children, parents, teachers, dancers, businessmen, yoga enthusiasts, gamers — you name it.



Touchjet Pond is magic...well, not really. It is pretty high-tech. Our infrared detection technology tracks the stylus and allows you to control and interact with the image that is projected on any surface at 40 frames per second.


The stylus has a tiny infrared emitter. Its signal is captured by the Touchjet Pond's tiny built-in infrared camera and processed by an image processor to convert it into touch screen coordinates.



Touchjet Pond is a portable, handheld gadget for those on the go. It's slightly heavier than a Samsung S4 phone and just about the same size. Easily fits in your pocket or your briefcase.




Touchjet Optical Touch Technology employs a special and advanced light processing unit (LPU). This exclusive design not only make any surface become a touch screen, but since the LPU execute all multi-touch processing, touch speed and accuracy is optimized. LPU is built in Touchjet Pond and sense the position of digital stylus which generates light source.




Touchjet Pond supports native Android apps, but since the screen goes beyond the limits of traditionally sized mobile screens, you can do so much more:

  • Develop board games that involve the whole family with several people playing on the wall or Android smartphones
  • Develop educational games, allowing teachers and students to interact with each other via the projected screen on smartphone
  • Build new apps to share, discuss ideas or projects on Interactive Table
  • Any app idea that could flourish with a larger screen will benefit from the features of Touchjet Pond

Meet the Touchjet WAVE.

Touchjet WAVE is the most affordable way to turn your TV into a giant touchscreen tablet with finger, stylus, and remote app control. Download the apps you love, use on your TV. It's a touchscreen when you want, or can be remote controlled from the couch, and comes with a  soft touch stylus so you don't have to worry about fingerprints. Stream movies, music, play all mobile games, share personal media content and make presentations with full interactivity. Learn more: www.touchjet.com/WAVE
